Reviews.Title: “Thompson - the lounge”
Reviews.Author: wittynamehere
Reviews.Content: Many co-workers of mine frequent the Thompson on Friday evenings especially. The decor is nice, the staff are all coordinated in cute dresses and the music is good. So what's the problem? $24 for a double shot of vodka is MASSIVE HIGHWAY ROBBERY. I won't even get STARTED on the roof situation. Dear Thompson: You are NOT fooling anybody with these antics. But alas it is King West... so if you are terribly skinny 20-something year old with a short dress and are looking for some "company" in the form of an elderly (probably married), rich, businessman I say have a blast at Thompson!

Reviews.Title: “downtown toronto chic”
Reviews.Author: happysanman
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent from valet to front desk. The Thompson Diner was great, had the eggs benedict...the best! What a view on the rooftop lounge had some excellent cocktails try the millonaire's martini. Japaneses Fusion Restaurant for dinner was great, really enjoyed the Sushi. Walked down the block for dessert the the Spice Route, excellent as well! Hotel lounge has great cocktails and nite time vibe. The halls did get noisy around the wee hours, so a little noisy. All in all enjoyable and great location

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style pampering in downtown Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: gonegaiting
Reviews.Content: The Thompson has a nice exclusive feel to it with helpful staff. The main floor lounge is great for people watching though the hotel is tucked away just south of bustling King West so you won't see the action on the streets but lots of movers and shakers come here for cocktails. Occasionally the service is uneven. I checked in late at night and there was no one at the door and I struggled to get my bags in. But room service is very fast. The Diner restaurant serves a great omelette for breakfast. The rooms are a good size and the rain style shower head is nice in the bathroom. Main quibble is the bed linens. My bed had no top sheet, only a thick duvet. Great if you are a chilly sleeper. I had them remade with a top sheet and blanket. The Wabora Japanese restaurant next to the hotel is okay but nothing special though the various Maki rolls are quite innovative (however lots of deep fried ingredients and cream cheese.) Scarpetta attached to the hotel has a good rep but I didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Thompson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoleV V
Reviews.Content: Cute rooms, good room service, but saturday night we decided to use the entertainment facilities. From the rooftop we were directed to Oliver for some sort of stamp to enter the club, he refused to help us and they didn't allow us to enter the club. Then dissapointed we went for drinks on the rooftop; after ordering champaine, it turned out it was sparkilng wine, they took it back. I already paid for it, and it took them almost an hour to replace it, after I brought it to their attention. I reward for service 17-25%; didn't get any change, so they kept 40%.No, I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “24 Hour Diner”
Reviews.Author: Kizmet9
Reviews.Content: Had dinner in the 24 hour Diner at Thompson Toronto - great experience - food was good and reasonably priced and the service was attentive but not intrusive. Roy did a super job for us. Would definitely go back - really fun evening.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: renaissancewoman99
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is relatively new on the scene. The staff is very attentive, and catered to our every request. The lobby bar was an excellent place for a relaxing cocktail after a long day of meetings. We really enjoyed relaxing at the rooftop bar and pool, they have beautiful views of the city. Attention to detail in the design of this hotel made it a special place to stay - from high thread count bedsheets, beautiful finishes, and the modern design. It's also located in a very cool part of town, just off the King West strip, where there's lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. We'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Fun, & Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karla P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Thompson with 3 of my girlfriends and it was amazing ! We stayed in the Double Deluxe room and it had everything we needed, the only problem was the lighting, it was very dim. But other than that it was super clean, and we enjoyed the heated bathroom floors ! The staff was very nice, and helpful. Collin brought our luggage to the room and helped us with whatever we needed, he was very helpful and friendly! We are already making plans to book again at the end of March ! Cant wait :)

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel/Pretentious Nightclub”
Reviews.Author: Brikv
Reviews.Content: The Thompson is a very cool hotel. The rooftop pool and bar are great and the rooms are modern and wonderfully designed. We came here for our honeymoon but found it to be very expensive and loud for our tastes. On weekends, hotel guests have to weave their way through the line for the club up at the door. In order to get to the rooftop bar you either have to be a guest or hold a membership to the bar. I wish they'd focus on the hotel and service rather than trying to turn it into a pretentious night club.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: Room was gorgeous and a terrific value, lobby area was impeccably-designed but became a bit of a scene in the evening. Rooftop bar was mobbed on a weekend - opted to not go anywhere near it. Dinner at Scarpetta was delicious but pricey, definitely felt like a franchised version of the original. Will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean yet sexy!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelspyguy
Reviews.Content: Very modern, chic with a twist, nice bathrooms with underfloor heating. Well trained staff

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but needs somewhere for soaking”
Reviews.Author: skobies
Reviews.Content: We were placed at this hotel through a discount hotel website and got a really great price. (This may be important so you know what kind of point of view we are coming from - we aren't business professionals). Very stylish hotel, felt underdressed just checking in. But once you get into your own room safe and sound, it's a fun place to stay. Rooms were immaculate, very sleek with lots of neat features. Note - no bathtub, and there was not hot tub or pool either (rooftop pool isn't open in the winter), so if you were hoping to immerse yourself in water, you are out of luck. There is parking in the neighborhood - right across the street the lot was $10 during the week and $15 on the weekend, so no need to pay for their $35 parking (unless you don't trust leaving your car out overnight, but the neighborhood felt safe). If there are events in the area I was told the prices of these lots might change though. Our room was by the elevator so it was a bit noisy, but the bed was SOOO comfortable and I slept great. Gym is pretty awesome, lots of equipment, there's also a yoga studio there (but it's almost $20 a class...) Rooftop bar is pretty swanky, if you are bringing friends though they recommend you make a reservation and get bottle service so you have somewhere to sit... views were great but we all ended up just going down to one of the pubs on the corner where beers are $5 and things felt a bit more real. No ice machines on the floors but if you call down they'll bring you ice up right away - service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “what a meal”
Reviews.Author: charles073
Reviews.Content: we ate in the resturaunt [I tried to write it but you never heard of it] The place was packed and for good reason the food was excellent the staff very good they know their business the recommendations were dead on even the wine which was priced well was great the last page on the menus is all for vegetarians the bar was also full and a great lobby to sit and talk

Reviews.Title: “Totally Fine”
Reviews.Author: tdpndc
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, my stay at the Thompson Toronto was nothing but positive. The hotel's valet and front desk staff were friendly and professional (extra points to Josh). My king superior room was clean, well-maintained and spacious, and I loved the modern - yet warm and cozy - decor (which is found throughout the property). I also appreciated the extra touches such as the heated floor in the bathroom and the lighting controls next to the bed. The comments regarding the great views from the rooftop are not exaggerations. In addition, for travelers seeking a quality fitness center, the Thompson Toronto's 24-hour facility delivers the goods - it's large and the equipment is state-of-the-art. My experience with the restaurants, Scarpetta and Thompson Diner, were limited but I did find the sleek designs appealing. It is true that the downstairs and rooftop bars are popular, and they can get loud and crowded; however, I did not encounter any noise issues in my room. I hope I have the opportunity to return to this property when the weather is warmer and I am able to fully enjoy the rooftop lounge and infinity pool.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: KGBRover
Reviews.Content: Have now done a second and final attempt at the Thompson Hotel in Toronto. Both stays have been for business and it is clearly not a business hotel. As many other reviews have indicated the hotel is very loud and the service is, at best, ambivalent.

Reviews.Title: “Loud people ruined a slightly above average stay”
Reviews.Author: ki_le2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over on a Monday night for a mini staycation. I noticed a light scent of stale smoke, but I ignored it. I figured it was just me, since Ontario had passed that "no smoking indoors" law a few years back. The rooms were clean and comfortable, I particularly liked the touch-activated light switches, and the heated floor in the bathroom was my favourite. Great until the people next door came back. It sounded like a good 6 people (all drunk) were packed into one room all trying to talk over one another. Several minutes later, it became obvious where the smoke smell had come from, as kids next door were clearly smoking pot and the fumes were wafting from under the door. A call down to the front desk did get the kids to quiet down a bit, but the marijuana smoke was a lost cause. We live in the city, so the location was not a big deal to us, but for those from out of town, the hotel is located in a gentrifying area, and in my personal opinion, quite a (walking) distance from anything of note. I would prefer to stay somewhere more central, and better lit at night if I wasn't familiar with the area.

Reviews.Title: “No signs of improvement, actually, the opposite.”
Reviews.Author: margot t
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that in the time since my last visit the Thompson has actually gotten worse, despite the amount of negative reviews they've received - I really can't believe nothing has been taken into account. I did stay elsewhere in the city, since the experience was so bad the first time. However we did visit the hotel for it's lobby bar -> Couldn't get in because the lineup of Jersey Shore wannabes (amazing that people want to behave in such fashion) was extensive & we were informed by the rude beefy security guard that we probably wouldn't be able to get in before last call (it was 11) A few days later we returned to visit The Counter, which I learned has changed names to The Thompson Diner. It seems the food quality has gone down, while the prices have gone up: Orange juice + pancakes for two rendered a near $60 bill - the orange juice was from concentrate while the pancakes were dry & tasteless, had NO sides (for $17 you would expect some bacon) & didn't even have a handful of fruit in them (banana pancakes were more like a hunt for banana in a whopping pile of cheap flour) Again, I am extremely disappointed in the quality of this hotel, considering the high caliber of service the American locations provide. The Canadian management clearly doesn't know much about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Scary for me and my girfriends”
Reviews.Author: SandraGasp
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasent check in, nice room, nice dinner at Scarpetta with friends. We ten decided to have drinks at the lobby bar and it was all ruined when we were approached about a couple of guys and girls trying to sell us drugs... Big turn off!!! We had heard about it before but just believed when it happened to us...

Reviews.Title: “Great spot great staff!”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the thompson toronto in mid November with my friend. Was a little unsure of what kind of service we were going to get since most of the reviews we have read are either 5/5 or 1/5, and most of the 1/5 reviews were from people who felt they were disrespected or under appriecated by the staff. I actually found the staff to be very pleasant, especially Shannon and Josh at the front door. They both were very kind and attentive to everything me and my friend needed and also very fast with any requests we had. I can completely understand why this hotel isn't for some people. Me and my friend are mid 20s business people who love a drink after a long days work, and whats better then having a great bar/lounge atmosphere in your hotel? We had dinner at Scarpetta one night and it was very good, the room service comes from their 24 hour dinner but took too long when we ordered it so decided not to a second time. The last night we were staying in the hotel we went to the rooftop bar to see what all the hype was about, and it lived up to the hype. It was a saturday night and it was packed! But not with 19 and 21 year old punks but with a very mature and very good looking crowd. They require you to get a stamp before you go to the rooftop but we just had our key in hand and it was no problem(by the way, they have very good looking hostess to stamp you!). All in all its a great hotel, and probably the nicest rooftop view I've seen in any city we have visited. We will be visiting again very soon and can't think of anywhere else we would like to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Management Does Not Stand Up to their word”
Reviews.Author: Marketman2001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nightmare we went to dinner at their restaurant scarpetta which was ok just not as good as the one in miami spend like $3500 for 12 people. Then we had 5 rooms at the hotel another $2500 which is steep for what you get. After all said and one we go to leave and get in my car drive away and realize my brand new 2011 car was ruined by their valet they ( they let me drive away) Hotel manager on duty then goes we did not know what happened i was like what? So then after that the valet said they opened up the door a cab had hit my car just before i got in and that they were unsure of this. So I go inside and that manger Stephanie who was really nice at the time was like if no one holds responsibilty the hotel will. I was like duh you pay the valet. We they did not I am now out $3700 because this hotel is so into them selfs and not their customers. After many e-mails and spending a total of $9700 at this hotel they lost a very good customer. So if you want service this hotel does not have it very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Thompson Diner - a great lunch spot”
Reviews.Author: stewart2726
Reviews.Content: Great eatery that is open 24 hours a day. Good range of options and of particular note were the Guiness milkshake and the macaroni cheese. Staff helpful but sometimes preoccupied, so service to begin with was a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “A new kind of hotel vibe for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: m b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the happening King West neighbourhood and is within easy walking distance of Toronto's business core, entertainment district and plenty of retail- and restaurant-lined streets. It feels welcoming from the minute you walk through the doors where the high ceilings give an airy and uplifting impression. The lobby bar is gorgeous and a great place to have a drink before heading out for the evening or if you are staying in to go to Scarpetta for dinner (highly recommended), which is also located at street level in the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable with beautiful, high-thread-count white linens and clean lines to the furniture. They are also spacious and have quality modern finishes. I loved the walk-in shower and the Tocca hair and body products, which added a chic touch. My only complaint was that it is a party hotel in the summer as the rooftop bar is a popular destination. It seems there were a lot of 20-somethings staying in the hotel - probably so they could get into the rooftop bar - so it was a bit noisy with people coming and going from their rooms and slamming doors. Management needs to address that. Also, the fire alarm went off several times during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: r7k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice overall. Because of its roof pool, it has quite the hipster scene in the summer. The rooms are fine. If you are looking for a hotel with a W vibe, this is a great choice. If you prefer something a little more sophisticated and higher end, the Hazelton is a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality of food from room service for four separate meals during my two night stay”
Reviews.Author: DesertTrojan
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed at Thompson Toronto for two nights. We got room service four separate times. We ordered about twelve different items throughout our four meals and one was as bad as the next. The rest of the hotel was of high caliber, however, the food was just really disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “I love the place, despite the bad reviews of others”
Reviews.Author: timhrose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here twice on business and both times were excellent. Yes, I could see that the evening crowd was young, very hip looking, almost Hollywood, and nothing wrong with that. We didn't spend much any real time at the bar but the ambience that this hip crowd created for the rest of the hotel was terrific. The rooftop was also nice, with great views of Toronto. The hotel is located in Toronto's west end and there is no end of nearby restuarants and bars. We always ate out and one of the many outstanding Toronto eateries. As for the property itself, the rooms were beautifully decorated, ample, with a great bathroom and terrific views. The hallways have Canada tongue in check phrases written into the wallpaper and are entertaining while walking to the elevator. The internet in the rooms is not free, which I don't like, but is in the hotel lobby and bar areas.The staff was professional and met our needs. I do see alot of hostility in some of the online reviews and there experiences are not mine. I travel internationally and extensively and I know a first class hotel when I am in it, and this is one.

Reviews.Title: “Not A "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: ronala
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Thompson and not one of those did I get a full night's sleep. The lobby-bar, crowded with suited middle aged men and mini skirted young women was beyond noisy, its clientele spilled into the street late at night or shouted in the hallways of the "hotel", or slammed doors that resonated throughout the floor, etc. Calls to the desk did nothing. Managers quoted the party line: "we have a lively hotel" and told us to go somewhere else if we didn't like it. The long and short is that the service was poor, attitude insulting, focus was on alcohol and ancilliary charges and that it is a huge stretch to call this a "hotel." One reviewer called it "sexy." I would call is "dumpy"!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE place!!”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveller020
Reviews.Content: Like the majority of Thompson Toronto reviewers, I found this hotel to be noisy beyond reason, but what makes it truly awful is the way "guests" are treated. The disrespect is staggering, something I have never seen in any hotel in any country. When I told the manager we hadn't slept in four nights because of the middle of the night screaming in the hallways, the constant shouting in front of the hotel and the pounding of techno music, I was told I should have stayed at the Crowne Plaza! The next morning, I found another manager who agreed with the first, that this "niche" hotel (translation: a disco with rooms above it) is not for everyone, and that included my husband and me. You might notice that Mr. Hayes, the guest relations guy, spends way too much time on this site apologizing to disgruntled guests. Management needs to take heed of that, yet we were told by management that the hotel is perfect just the way it is, and "we're not going to change because you don't like it." Right. Bottom line: If you like to sleep at night, and if you like to be treated by staffers with kindness rather than disdain, there are many fine hotels in Toronto to choose from. This place is the worst in the city, and even the residents in the King Street W. community are annoyed by the disturbance the Thompson has caused.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service + unwelcoming staff + loud rooms = Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: W W
Reviews.Content: 4 Night Stay M-Th Dec 2011 - As a previous guest of Thompson in NY, had high hopes - but was extremely disappointed. Level of service/training was poor with conflicting information provided by Front Desk & Manager throughout our stay regarding pets. Nobody smiles. Asked 4-times to have on-line $25 promo credit applied to our account and still had to ask again at check-out to have it applied. Informed front desk twice and 3rd time at check-out that was leaving a day early, and was still charged $300 for an extra night. Awakened at 2:30AM every-night to honking and yelling for an hour as hotel bars close. Charged a different rate than what showed online. Would not recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to stay in if you want fun and if you want sexy!”
Reviews.Author: bobbalfe1981
Reviews.Content: For starters the girls are beautiful at this hotel. That's all I really need to write! This hotel is very nice from head to toe. The roof top bar is very trendy and the lobby bar seems to be where all the best looking people in Toronto meet before they head out at night. The rooms are very nice and clean. The place also has a decent gym on the 3rd floor. Perfect location for a night out on the town. This will be my go to hotel whenever I am in Toronto. You get what you pay for. I would say this hotel is not for people who are no fun. All negative reviews are by stuck up people. Its a hotel, not your house. This place is designed for people who want to have fun. You can party upstairs and downstairs and when you want to call it a night the rooms are very quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CJ R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this beautiful hotel about a month in total and my recent stay in Nov was wonderful, the room was exceptional with an amazing king size bed and bathroom with marble heated floors. The art and furniture add to the great design of the rooms and hotel. The roof top bar is worth the visit and the lobby bar is fun to spend time in. The staff and service is friendly and wonderful, all in all staying at the Thompson is definitely a great experience, I would recommend it especially to those who would enjoy what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Style and substance”
Reviews.Author: BENZAMG
Reviews.Content: Great impressions of this addition to the Toronto hotel scene.My superior room was spotless with a nice view of Wellington.The lobby and rooftop bars were happening and the service at both was spot on and friendly.I would not consider this a business hotel per se but great for people in fashion,arts entertainment etc..Great place to bring a date or find a date with plenty of hip dining and drinking options near by.The Counter is a must for a late night,booze filled nosh.

Reviews.Title: “The Now Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: Our choice of hotels while in Toronto. Great rooms, great staff and easy access with a vehicle. The Rooftop Lounge Bar is cool ... was that Jay -Z that was here for a drink the night before his concert in Toronto ... yes it was !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the first time this past weekend, it surpassed my expectations in every way. Service, staff, rooms, restaurants, and overall ambiance were amazing. Heated floors - need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Really nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miki S
Reviews.Content: I love the look and bustle of this hotel. The room was very nice as well and I loved the heated bathroom floors. The bed and the sheets were fantastic and the rooftop lounge is definitely something to take advantage of when you're here. The diner next door was definitely worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great service !! Great hotel !! No snobs here !!”
Reviews.Author: PG102
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews before staying at this hotel that said that the personnel was a bit snobby or did not pay attention to the guests. NOT TRUE !! As soon as I drove up the valet was nice enough to let me park on the street while I checked in and freshened up in the room before heading back out. He also offered me the different parking options at the hotel which saved me some $$. Check-in was speedy my guess is the hotel wasn't full that night so I was gracefully upgraded to a Deluxe room. I had already gotten a great deal on priceline.com. Then, I got up to my room and the bellboy hung my business clothes carefully in the closet and directed me to the the amenities in my room and at the hotel. Overall a great experience. The only knock on this place is....yup, you guessed it, the noise. They're located across a very busy street. If you want a little less noise I recommend a room at the back of the hotel (Northeast corner) Far from Bathurst street.

Reviews.Title: “interesting boutique hotel, great service...but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: MAMCalgary
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely boutique hotel ...the front staff are delightful...most welcoming but if you are trying to check in at night when the bar is full and noisy, you and the check in staff will have difficulty hearing each other and might even have to shout!!! The rooms are very comfortable with the light switches small and unobtrusive.They have their description printed on them in small letters, in English only.So that also means that you cannot just easily turn on the light, you have to read the button. This is difficult for those who have poor vision ( you will need to put your glasses on first) and for those who are not English speaking...you might be in the dark, literally!!! The bed is really comfortable...awesome mattress. The bathroom floor is heated and a lovely addition to comfort. The sayings on the walls next to the elevators are interesting to say the least...on one of the floors it read : " there was a woman knocking on the door of my room all night...I finally got up to let her out". That may be funny to some, but to others it is politically incorrect. The food is absolutely awesome...great chef who really knows what she/he is doing. So, all in all, an interesting place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, amazing staff, love to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying at the Thompson on several occasions. Each stay the room has been beautiful with modern comfortable amenities, the service fantastic. From the moment we arrive to the time we check out the staff are friendly, professional and responsive to our needs. Last year we stayed at the Thompson to attend the One Of a Kind Show, we were able to jump on the streetcar and arrived within minutes. The hotel is also minutes away from Queen Street a shopping experience not to missed when visiting Toronto. Thanks Thompson, we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Moirc
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything negitive about my stay there. The Thompson is a beautiful hotel with great rooms and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller who spends 60-80 nights in hotels every year. I first stayed at the Thompson after getting a great rate on Priceline. Convenient location;the rooms are spacious and spotless. The bar and the diner are great too. The staff is second to none; from the front desk to the bellmen, they are attentive and accomodating--and always remember your name. As a result of my experience, my company now uses the Thompson whenever business brings us here...as for the noise complaints, I never noticed. But then again, I am from NY!!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel Near CN Tower”
Reviews.Author: nycndc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very sexy and sleek. Rooms were modern and the bathroom with heated floors and glass enclosed shower were wonderful. The staff was very helpful and receptive. I would defintely stay at the Thompson again. Great rooftop lounge and pool. Must be awesome in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “this place is ok and yes i would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: this place is ok if you want a quiet hotel then don't stay here but if u like somewhere buzzing then its the perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Noise. Noise. Noise.”
Reviews.Author: arrxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Thompson recently when we were in Toronto on business. While the hotel is fine we were awaken by taxis and cars outside honking their horns at 2:00 in the morning on a Tuesday and Wednesday. The neighborhood is quiet and lovely. The hotel is across from a great urban park. Unless you stay up until 3:00 stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: tanyamess
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel and I am extremely surprised with the poor reviews. Iâ€™m in sales and I travel all over north America so I have had my share of hotel experience. From the moment that I checked in I was impressed. Customer service is extremely important to me and this hotel did not disappoint!! For starters the hotel lobby is incredible!! When I walked in I forgot I was in Toronto as not many hotels in Toronto are this cool or happening on a Sunday night. The front desk was very friendly and as soon as I walked into my room I received chocolate brownies and a lovely thank-you note. Which is always appreciated when travelling. So the Room was absolutely incredible!! The room and bathroom were impressively clean. Other goodies include 2 large screen tvâ€™s, heated bathroom floors, automatic lighting, most comfortable bed and pillows and what a view! I forget how beautiful Toronto is at night and the hotel is situated so that you have a gorgeous view! I also dined at the restaurant in the lobby called scarpetto and the food was exquisite. It was their 1 year anniversary so I had a 5 course meal with accompanying wine with each plate for $50. Most importantly the hotel is situated on a street that is not too busy so the room was very quiet at night which is important for business travellers that need to get up early the next day! Overall, I was extremely satisfied and will definitely be coming back for all my future travels business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Time & money better spent elsewhere in the neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: margot t
Reviews.Content: It's a gorgeous weekend. At the start of it I tried to bring a client to the rooftop for a drink - there were several staff but was told that we couldn't be served. Fine. We went downstairs to have a drink in the lobby but again were told that the bar wasn't open (it was late afternoon). Today I thought, since it was such a beautiful hot day, an afternoon by the pool might be in order. As it turned out not only was the pool off-limits, but the whole roof was closed so we couldn't even enjoy the afternoon in the sun on the rooftop restaurant patio. I was really trying to spend money at various venues at the hotel, but it was completely unaccommodating. *It should also be noted that the lobby furniture has tears & frays in the upholstery which look better at night than during the day - if you are considering a business related meeting I'd suggest considering one of the many classier venues in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “hip, happening & all in all a fab stay”
Reviews.Author: natkathleen
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying here on two separate occasions now, one business and one pleasure. Both times my stay has exceeded expectations with gorgeous rooms, delicious food & service in the restaurants and always feeling like a very welcomed guest. I find the location very convenient for getting around toronto yet just tucked away so that you can feel relaxed and out of the downtown hustle. My most recent stay was for the most fabulous wedding ever, the entire day was so meticulously planned and executed, myself and all guest were smiling, laughing and having the time of our lives. I will definitely make the Thompson Toronto my go-to hotel for the area! Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Bride and Groom should be first - Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: SolarDante
Reviews.Content: This is to let everyone know that Thompson Hotel Toronto - Wedding Banquet management took it upon themselves to completely put themselves first before putting the well paying Bride, Groom and guests first. I've never experienced such self-interested business tactics that as I did at my best friend's wedding this past weekend. The banquet director, floor manager openly reprimanded bartenders who gave a groom, guests any full ounce of alcohol as standard practice. Thompson management basically went stingy at 9PM with the open bar. Everything was actually beautiful, food was amazing, venue stylish, front line staff super classy. It was the management that gave everyone a hard time and arbitrarily started to cut completely sober people off alcohol. Guests included doctors, lawyers, and other professionals who were simply sticking up for the groom - who wanted a shot. Too many rules and controlling tactics for welling paying guests is blatantly tacky and below the class Thompson Toronto claims itself to have. For those of you planning a future wedding a Thompson Hotel, make sure they clarify in writing what the rules are around the open bar. It was a negative experience and I cannot believe Management would do this at someone's wedding reception. LOW CLASS.

Reviews.Title: “"Wow - What More Can I Say?!"”
Reviews.Author: Kevin H
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped in the door I loved the vibe, the luxury, the amenities and the service. The Thompson exceeded my expectations â€“ trendy, fun and sophisticated â€“ it is centrally located and has so much to offer including a rooftop bar (with a magnificent view), a yoga studio and a great workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Home in The City”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with the Thompson family - they own and operate four properties in Canada. The Toronto property manages the impossible - a very contemporary decor with ALL the feelings of home! The guest rooms are sleek and comfortable. Closets include a fluffy robe, multiple hangers - including the satin ones we ladies love....mini bar...and dresser all built into a modern schraunk. The desk has a hidden panel that houses multiple multiple plugs and every type of connection / plug you could possibly need. But the bed and pillows......so comfortable. Perfect for the exhausted traveler who needs to recharge. My favorite features: Heated floors in the bathroom....and ...You can operate all of the lights in the room from any and all of the light switch panels - even the one built into the nightstand! There are multiple restaurants and two night clubs....but the club on the roof top is only open to hotel guests! BREATH TAKING VIEWS! Service levels are spot in here. The staff is very friendly and will do there best to accommodate all requests. The food....AMAZING! I especially love the 24 hour diner....the name appropriately named THE DINER. In order to insure you get the best cup of coffee.....they will deliver to your room 24 hrs a day....none of the mickey mouse toy coffee makers for this hotel! Their coffee is some of the best I have ever had. Beware. All in all a great hotel for business travelers and mature audiences tucked into a great location. Great for Groups / Conferences of 50 - 75 attendees!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: As a true fan of the Thompson Hotels in NYC it would only go without saying that I would choose The Thompson when in Toronto. The service is amazing, from the doormen to concierge all are first class. If you are looking for a truly classy boutique hotel experience then this hotel is perfect. The food at Scarpetta is superb and the the rooftop bar and view are breathtaking......I travel on business to Toronto several times a year and I truly feel this hotel to be my second home. What hotel doorman remembers your name three mont after your first stay. A fine example of luxury....this is one brand that definitely lives upto its reputation. Will be back for Christmas.........

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: briansit
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Smyth in TriBeCa several times, I found the atmosphere, decor, and bespoke service levels consistent at the Thompson Toronto. I have been reading a lot of negative reviews here and have noticed that a lot of them are a result of getting denied from accessing the roof -- possibly from non-guests of the property. There is something good to be said about a hotel that manages to maintain exclusivity of it's amenities to their guests who spend a lot of money to stay at the property. We will definitely return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning.”
Reviews.Author: bryanmohr1
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Toronto, the Thompson Hotel epitomizes everything Toronto stands for: style, class and hospitality. The rooms were beautiful. The staff is incredible and the view from the rooftop bar is second-to-none.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an awesome part of town.”
Reviews.Author: aaronchristensen
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was great, from having the door opened for you as you enter the hotel to bartenders and waitresses on the rooftop bar. The rooftop bar was a highlight and has an amazing view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel terrible servce”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellervancit
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to list all the lavish hotels i've stayed at to make it seem like i know what im talking about because when it comes down to it theirs hotels with staff that are dying to please you and make your stay amazing and there are ones like the thompson toronto that dont care. Ill start off with the security who think the hotel is a club. Hire staff that have good customer service skills and know how to speak to guests just as much as the front desk people because they are the first people who I see entering the hotel. The reason why this wont be a 5 star is because of this. In order to have 5 star the bellman's are supposed to greet you politely and usher you in. Not being looked at rudely like security. I went up to the rooftop for a dip and the bald security guy was arrogant and extremely condescending. I asked for a towel and he pointed to where they were without looking up from his phone- the only time he did look at me was to ask if i was even staying at the hotel. The food service staff didnt come up to me once to ask for a drink and i was there for an hour. The only positive experience was Paula, Julie, and Saye. Whom are VERY professional and clearly know how to run a hotel and be poilite at all times. They need a new security team who knows how to speak to hotel patrons. Room service is good, food was excellent in the counter, scarpetta was excellent. Overall service is terrible visually appealing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, view and value”
Reviews.Author: dhabes
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, but have (almost) nothing but praise for the Thompson TO. Pros: The rooms - I stayed in a king (or whatever the standard one-bed room is) and expected a tiny room. Instead, I walked into a large, open room furnished very nicely. The bed was extremely comfortable as well. The roof - It's hard not to love a view like the Thompson roof. The value - Toronto isn't a cheap city but the room rate was very reasonable. I've stayed in more expensive hotels in TO but none delivered this value (and style). The staff - From the front desk to the bartenders, all were very extremely pleasant and professional. Cons: Smokers - Have folks not heard that cigars are obnoxious and smell terrible? The rooftop at night still has a great view, but (even though outside) it's thick with cigar smoke. Cigarettes are bad enough, but the heavy smoke ruins the outdoor space. Tiny buttons (a tiny complaint) - Ok...now I'm getting picky...The light buttons in the rooms are made for the fingers of an eight-year old. It seems the designer got a bit too fancy for practicality. Shower (a small complaint) - The shower looks very nice, but doesn't function very well (cold air, weak water pressure, misplaced shelf). Still, it's better than many. Wifi - C'mon...Don't charge for Wifi...just include it in the room rate please. Overall, my complaints are minor and positives major. I'll stay here again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Working the hip hotel vibe a little too hard while forgetting service.”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: The Thompson tries a little too hard to be the chic urban city hotel while forgetting what makes a hotel truly good. When we checked in, I think we stood at the counter for a solid 5 minutes before we were even acknowledged by the woman at the front desk who was on the phone. A simple nod or glance would have been fine, but nothing. And even when she hung up the phone it took her a good couple of beats to acknowledge us. Another front desk person had walked to the front while we were standing there and she failed to acknowledge us as well. Just checked something on the computer and went back to the back office. It's a little too 'scene-y' for my taste. Dark hallways, dark elevators. The rooms were thankfully bright due to tall windows that did open (a huge plus in my book). The rooms were spacious and clean. The bed was comfy. I ended up in a room directly across from the elevator (which was annoying after specifically requesting a room AWAY from the elevator) and without my ear plugs I could hear people in the hallway at night. The roof is a bit of a club scene which trickles down somewhat into the hotel. Breakfast room service was very, very fast (another plus). WiFi was $15 a day - seriously? Hotels have got to stop charging for WiFi in this day and age. Location was okay, a little out of the way, but the views from the rooftop were nice and it was a little neighborhood which I do like as opposed to being smack in the middle of downtown. Service was just lacking and it felt a little bit too much like a 25 year old person's hotel. Not great for business.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure this hotel is what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: DeKokkies
Reviews.Content: We booked the Thompson hotel primarily because of its rooftop swimming pool and bar, expecting the views of Torono to be amazing. Which they were. The room was great, the bed was very good. Service from the concierge was always very good. But... - The pool and bar are not just for hotel guests: it's a club people are lining up for outside. - During night, elevators with shouting people were going down. We first thought this was in the corridor but it turned out to be the elevators bringing people down when the place closed. Apparently the sound isolation of the rooms is poor plus the hotel allows people to shout in the middle of the night. - One of the mornings one of us went swimming. Two girls were sleeping on the sofa's at the pool side with some towels for blankets and still fully clothed in party outfit from the night before. Unbelievable security didn't pick that up but we guess it fits into the picture of the previous bullet. - During one of the afternoons we walked into the elevator and found ourselves, with one other very embarrassed guest, in the middle of a group of people that were already completely drunk and they were very rude. When they got out on their floor, one of these people even kept the elevator door open a couple of times when it wanted to close, shouting all sorts of nonsens to us. - As hotel guests we couldn't sit anywhere during the evening as all tables were reserved for bottle service. - Service during the day was average and the staff behaved rather arrogant. - At some stage, we ordered a pitcher of sangria. Never tasted something like this in Spain... - No free wifi but a staggering 15 CAD per 24 hours with the clock ticking even if you don't use it. Again, the view from the rooftop was spectacular but had we known in advance what type of hotel this is, we would have selected another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and Clueless”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the reception advised that "the Thompson Suite" was available and asked if we wanted to upgrade. It would only be $800, from the regular price of $2,000....or more. I can't recall the exact amount. I do know it was over $2000. Thinking it was a great deal, my husband agreed. I don't believe the manager/owner, or whomever is responsible for the quality of the "Thompson Suite", has ever spent the night in a five star $800/nt suite, let alone a $2,000 suite. (A couple of suggestions would be Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental.) The cold grey balcony was bare and full of chipped concrete. Patio furniture would have been a nice touch. You step outside and look to your right to see a row of messy unkept balconies - must have been owner occupied suites in need of extra storage. Unsightly. The TV unit was broken with a cabinet almost off its hinges. The furniture was worn, carpets and countertops stained. All in all it was a huge disappointment. And staying in the Thompson Suite didn't even give you the privilege to sit in the reserved bottle service only areas. The corridors looked cheap and were too bright. The bed, however, was comfortable. My only compliment. A very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: winelover010
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at Thompson in Toronto. Checked out the rooftop bar, it had great views, great cocktails (slow service though). The rooms were luxurious, they beds werer incredibly comfortable and they had fantastic bathroom amenitites. We went downstairs to Scarpetta for dinner, this was fantastic. The food and service were flawless. They also have a fantastic gym just make sure you take a towel down with you because they don't supply them.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be New York and forgetting the class”
Reviews.Author: LADYBROUHAHA
Reviews.Content: This is one of those aren't we just so chic hotels that cultivates an attitude of snobbery in place of actual service to their patrons perhaps under the misguided belief that rudeness equals status and snobery sophistication. Anyone who has stayed at a truly fine and established hotel, or even just read about one in a travel magazine...I'm thinking Claridge's in London, The Crillon in Paris...you the idea...knows that it is part of the culture of a classic luxury hotel that it caters to it's clientele...their whims, their needs , their every possible comfort and thus their desire to return again and again wallet at the ready... After dealing with a foul mouthed receptionsist who had all the grace of a junk yard dog when I simply asked her how long a waiting list as I stood for over a half hour among a throng of over heated and not very happy guests in a line on the lobby, for an obviously over booked party on the fabled roof-tope terrace ( I've seen it before...it's a bar with a great view of Toronto...isn't going to change lives) I decided to come here and let you all in on the secret about this so-called "it hotel" in Toronto---whatever that actually means . It seems that two letters are missing from IT and you know the ones. You won't like it at the Thompson. They won't like you and they'll let you know again and again ( especially if you have the audacity to actually ask for something, like say the time, a drink, or for perhaps just a little common decency behooving, let's not mince words here---wait staff, service people, reception clerks). You see this was not my first experience with the nasty, noses bet out of joint staff at the Thompspon. It is simply routine at the Thompson to treat their guests like unwelcome vermin. If the Thompson want to make it and by that I mean survive into this decade with a bone fide reputation, they are going to have to face facts and stop shoveling their own flash in the pan hyped up nonsense...The Thompson Hotel needs an attitude overhaul. NOW. Fire the sniveling frontline and bring in some experienced staff who know a thing or two about serving patrons and cultivating a lasting clientele. People as a general rule do not willingly pay to get abused, talked down to and ignored by a gaggle of morons. The half wits running the front stage at this very nice looking hotel as though they were guards in a goulag are going to sink it....and I am not alone ( not by a long shot) in saying that I will not sink another dime into this wannabe, thibnks it's NYC establishment until it cleans up its act...and gets some class.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: ralfmadi
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Thompson Hotel in Toronto. it has everything to offer from a great rooftop patio that over looks Toronto and by far has the best view in the city with a great bar and pool. The staff is very accommodating and friendly witch helps the experience that much more. The rooms are modern and comfortable and ther gym is one of the best as far as what hotels have to offer. They have 3 great restaurants and is conveniently located close to some great restaurants and nightlife. if you are visiting Toronto Thomson is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It was not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: csasani
Reviews.Content: The hotel design and location was beautiful and very modern. However we paid $225 a light and although the rooftop patio was amazing, it was very dirty. I was at the pool on the Saturday and went there again Sunday morning. There were drink glasses from the night before littered around the pool and had not been cleaned the night before. They could have been cleaned up the next day even considering there was staff around, but by 11:30 a.m. nothing had been cleaned. The pillows on the outdoor furniture were very dirty and clearly had not been replaced. Pool was also dirty with lots of bugs and you could tell it had not been cleaned for awhile. The room was also dirty and I felt like it had not been cleaned well. Overall, this hotel has potential but due to uncleanliness I was very unhappy considering the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in a hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: ZZinger
Reviews.Content: Booked the Thompson for a girls weekend - after positive experiences in their hotel in NYC, was excited to go. But this hotel is the biggest let down in Toronto, with absolutely no service. From the get go at check in we got a rude greeting from the front desk, to the parade of security men they have on guard all around the pool to ensure not even a glass of water doesn't make it near the pool deck. At lunch it took 2 hours for a salad, and hummous plate. But the real kicker was the evening. As others have commented, the walls are paper thin - and I mean no insulation. We were sleeping by midnight on Saturday to be awoken at 2am by at least 75 people in the room next to us having a full on party. The front desk took 1.5 hours to deal with the situation, so it was 3:30AM before we go to bed. The worst part, they are so lacklustre about it, you should expect not to sleep if you go to the Thompson. From almost every single employee to the top manager on duty, they do not care about customer service, and noise at 2am is also not even reason to start to up their game. If you are there to party and be seen, this is your place. Due to all of the partying going on here, the rooms are worn after only 2 years in business, attention to detail has been missed everywhere, and you get no service. Should you stay here? Absolutely not! You can do better in Toronto!!

Reviews.Title: “The devil is in the details”
Reviews.Author: mandjatx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at one other Thompson property and found it great. Except for the amazing rooftop bar, the Toronto location was a huge letdown. Used half-full toiletries left in the bathroom, swabs, kleenex not refilled, cheap/stained towels, ridiculous placement of electrical outlets, shower design that ensures wet floors, worn-out furniture in the lobby, and no accoustic buffering in the hallways- there is horrid attention to detail in the hotel. Took breakfast in the attached 'diner' to be summarily ignored by the hipster staff. Food price and quality was great but the service was horrible. Design and location are great, and again, the rooftop bar is just fantastic- but, if you're expecting service and attention to details this particular location may dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top Patio Often Closed For Private Parties”
Reviews.Author: PETERWEEMS
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is quite polite. Amenities are good. However, perhaps the best feature of the hotel is their rooftop patio. One might call it their calling card. Just to warn potential guests - this part of the hotel is often closed for private parties. I recommended this hotel to a group of 8 business people and they were quite 'pissed off' that the patio was closed for 2 or their 6 night stay. I can't say I blame them. Annoyed

Reviews.Title: “A real mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: caymancaribbeansun
Reviews.Content: It's somewhat rare that you manage to hit such opposites with one place. After reading the reviews here I called and requested a "quiet" room as we are light sleepers. Handled quickly, efficiently and pleasantly with no problem at all - nice. Arrival - excellent front desk staff, excellent valet - nice. Roof top pool - hmmm... Jersey shore? Wall to wall young people trying their best to look good. Okay, not for us but not really a big deal and I can see how it would appeal to others. Arrival back at hotel around midnight - long lines of 20 somethings waiting to get into either the rooftop bar or the one on the main floor. Okay then, so is this a hotel or a nightclub? Nightclub would be the correct answer. The room - stylish, well appointed and really quite well done with a few rather significant technical design flaws. The room is beyond noisy - you can hear absolutely everything that's happening on what seems like the entire floor. Not a big deal at 6pm but not good at 3am. The wall of the shower is glass, there are no curtains or blackout drapes/blinds so as a result the room was way too bright for sleeping comfortably - all the light and noise from the street streamed through the glass with no way to block it out. Then having been up until 3am the morning sun came blazing through way too early. If you are between 20-30, intend on staying up until 3-4am, are okay with street/hall/other room noises and don't mind sleeping in bright light this is a great place. If any of those items don't describe you this might not be the place for you - particularly if you want to actually sleep in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great view!”
Reviews.Author: sonic-burger
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto, but I decided to check out The Thompson with some friends. The Thompson has by far the best views of the city, nevermind the CN Tower this is where its at! The pool is great considering the fact that very very few toronto hotels actually have outdoor pools! I found the staff to be nice and accommodating, although they did take sometime with the orders - but you just have to relax! you're on vacation! The only thing I can complain about is that the pool isn't open for swimming past 7! Come on! I love night swimming!!

Reviews.Title: “Are you a pretentious wanna-be? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: IDeserveBetter
Reviews.Content: This hotel pretends to be something price-wise and looks-wise that, in reality, it is not even close to being. They trump up their Scarpetta restaurant like it's Spago or something and the food was not good and way overpriced. They try to make it all feel so "exclusive and upscale" and it falls way short.

Reviews.Title: “for the cool kids”
Reviews.Author: gal1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, rooms are really amazing. Rooftop pool and lounge very cool. Italian restaurant in the hotel a little stuffy. 24 hour restaurant excellent food and service. Being 'on' the entire time can get a little old lol I had called ahead to check the diference in the room versus rates and the info was slightly misleading. When I arrived, I was given a basic room when I had booked an upgrade. I was charged another $50 for the upgrade. When I asked later, I was informed I had a bigger upgrade and was in fact given a very good rate. Should be a little more clear at the outset.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: trippy051
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Priceline "Name your own Price" stay, for about 1/4 of the published rates. No way would I pay $300 to stay here! It's a very trendy place, with unusual, but not unattractive decor. For example, the bathroom is separated from the main part of the room by a frosted glass 'wall'. The windows are mostly frosted glass, too, from floor to ceiling. There is just one panel you can actually see through. There is a rooftop swimming pool/bar area, which was booked for a private party the night I arrived, but opens early in the morning. There are nice views of the city, and the pool looked nice, although it is on the small side, as you might expect. The room was perfectly clean, the bed was comfortable and the linens luxurious, I would say, so I have no complaints. I had read reviews that said it was noisy, but I did not find that to be a problem in the slightest. For such a high-priced hotel, it seems to be in a sort of run-down neighborhood, but maybe it is becoming gentrified. It's a little bit away from the real center of downtown, but there is convenient public transportation, and it doesn't take long at all to get to more interesting places. The lobby staff was very helpful in suggesting things to do and ways to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: kim12320
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, with a sleek, modern feel. Both restaurants were excellent and the staff and service at the hotel was outstanding. The best part--the rooftop bar and pool with spectacular views of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Toronto for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Undeniably Cool”
Reviews.Author: Shiraz81
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel is probably the best Hotel in Toronto. This was the first time I stayed there and I was so impressed that I can honestly say that it will not be the last. The staff, lobby and rooms are impeccable. It impressed me as being a modern, chic, luxury boutique hotel that is situated downtown, close to all your needs. The staff is very friendly and will go to great lengths to get you what you want. The rooms are spacious and loaded with all modern technologies, not to mention the comfy beds. The food at the counter diner is incredible. They have a roof top bar which offers excellent views of downtown Toronto equipped with the sexiest pool which is open late to hotel guest and the spicy margaritas are great. In addition, they have a club on board offering good music and drinks. Overall this hotel is worth every penny you spend and the treatment you get makes you feel like a king.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Start Our Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cantstoptravelling28
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto and was planning our wedding at the Palais Royale when the Thompson opened. We were driving by one day and The Counter caught my attention so we stopped to enjoy the cool new diner. After an..overwhelmingly delicious breakfast..we wandered into the hotel and asked for a tour, thinking we would use it as a hotel of choice for our wedding invites. Just walking around the lobby we realized that the hotel was impressive and cool, but maybe not particularly suited to or guests needs. It was when we reached the top floor we decided that WEHAD to stay here, particularly me and my girlfriends to get ready for the big day. The room as spacious and sparkling clean. It had a large kitchen and dining area with plenty of light (perfect for start-out photos). We had tonnes of stuff, and the bellhop was very helpful and happy making multiple trips with our deliveries throughout both days.We had breakfast from the Counter both days and we're happy both times (once was roomservice). Found the sushi place to be meh for the money. We hosted a night-before party on the rooftop lounge and in our room and were never given a hard time by security for any back and forth trips and access requirements for outside guests. The day of the wedding we went to the rooftop again for photos- great view and lots of space! The staff were very accommodating and appeared happy to have our wedding party and photographers hang around the lounge and the lobby before heading to the Palais. Thanks Thompson for the easy start to a great weekend :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - swanky bars, gorgeous large rooms, fun location”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: The standard king room is the most basic room they have, but it's gorgeous, beautifully designed, and large. Light switches are really cool and you can turn on or off any light from the toilet if you want. Or bedside.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Trendy Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canuckontour
Reviews.Content: This is a new, trendy boutique style hotel in a great location near King West. I stayed here for 3 nights and overall enjoyed this property. The rooms are fresh with warm tones, stylish with the highlight being the well designed and appointed bathroom. This is the type of bathroom you wish you could recreate at home. Great apothecary bathroom amenities as well. The bed linens were of high quality and very comfortable. This hotel is a bit of a party central property and there is a lot of traffic in the halls. The lobby bar was a buzz of activity for the well dressed, trendy crowd and if you enjoy this scene you will love the Thompson. Front desk and concierge staff have definitely been selected on their "model" looks with their impeccably groomed appearance which is a reflection of this hotel's stylish brand. I had breakfast every morning at Counter and loved the vibe. The diner feel of yesteryear is well executed and I enjoyed the food and coffee each morning. The staff that served me there were all very nice and engaged in conversation. I enjoyed the music. Who doesn't like a little Fleetwood Mac and Patsy Cline to start your day sipping a cup of coffee? This property was within a quick walking distance for my business meetings which was convenient on these colder mornings. I would highly recommend you head up to the top floor bar for a drink once during your stay and marvel at the best view of downtown Toronto. I would recommend this hotel and hope to be back here and to discover more Thompson hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Swank Space with great service and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: ksbDetroit
Reviews.Content: We loved it -- the hotel was cushy and comfortable, the staff was on top of things and we loved the vibe. We loved having choices of types of food connected to it -- great sushi, great diner food and the bar played great music (even if the ambience wasn't exactly our vibe). We loved it and would totally stay there again when money allows.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud at night”
Reviews.Author: ksmithderm
Reviews.Content: We were at the Thompson on the weekend with about 20 colleagues for a business meeting. Nice staff, nice rooms and meeting. BUT poor soundproofing [in a "hip" hotel with a high-energy, youngish market special effort should be made to have good sound proofing between rooms and from room to hall. Anyway, tired after a long day of work and travel, we [and some of our colleagues] were annoyed by noise from the hall and partying in other rooms during the night. Security quickly shut down a party at 3 AM when I complained. This and other hotels ought to try to put business travelers on a quiet floor, and away from elevators. This meeting was booked quite a long time ago, so that should have been possible Another thing is that the plug ins were hidden under a panel on the desk top. I am not hip enough to sort that out at 10 PM, so it would be good to LABEL the panel "plugs". I noted that it would have been impossible to plug in a little transformer, so business travellers [like myself] would probably prefer a good old power strip to this elegant, obscure approach to providing power. We usually go to the Park Hyatt, and my recommendation was that we go there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... I would go back”
Reviews.Author: Brichford
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Thompson. Some of the benefits that come to mind... a great location made it easy to walk downtown, along King Street, etc. I really liked the room - well appointed and perfect for a solo traveler on business but would have been great with my wife. I like the modern design and the built-ins. Well done. The exercise room was excellent and I was thrilled to find a hotel gym with free weights heavier than 50 lbs. Overall very cool design. The sushi at Wabora was good... not great... but good enough for me. I did really like The Counter and ate a couple of meals there. The downside - the wireless didn't work perfectly and I'm never a fan of paying for Internet access. Service at times was a bit aloof but, whatever, I can deal with that. I didn't hear any noise but I was there mid-week. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to friends and would gladly stay there again. Have stayed at a Thompson Hotel in D.C. and really like the brand.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to actually get a good nite's rest..stay elsewhere! This is PARTY CENTRAL not a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stampergirl1970
Reviews.Content: I have to say first that I loved our room when we first arrived. Beautiful dark hardwood floors and floor to ceiling windows that fronted onto the front of the hotel. Our room was on the sixth floor so didn't think we would have to deal with street noise. Boy were we wrong! The rooms have no sound barrier between them nor from the street below. There are two clubs in the hotel that are hopping on the weekend and the noise from them is deafening! We had attended a wedding there so decided it best to stay overnite and have a little mini vacation from the kids and hopefully be able to have a nice sleep in on the Sunday. We went back to our room after the wedding ended around 1am. We were kept up until 4:30 AM due to the noise of our neighbours who decided to have a party in their room which kept spilling out into the hallway right outside our door. We called security twice to come up because the amount of people inside the room and outside our door at 3am was insane. They were shouting and fighting and it was a complete mess! There was no way anyone on the 6th floor got any sleep that nite. Security came up once but let them off with a warning. We called a second time after trying to sleep for an hour to the noise and they never arrived. Finally our neighbors settled down around 4:30am! We literally had 2 hours sleep before the doors started slamming again in the morning. I could NOT get out of the hotel FAST ENOUGH! If you value your sleep at ALL I would not advise you to stay here. When we checked out they asked how our stay was and we said it was a disaster that we had to keep calling down because of the noise and they said they had alot of complaints that nite! No kidding! They must decide which is it a HOTEL OR A CLUB??!! Never again....

Reviews.Title: “New favourite hotel in Toronto for us.”
Reviews.Author: JonesBurner
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for my birthday weekend. I had booked this spot for him a few weeks earlier because it was close to the convention center where he was going to a show. He loved it, so brought me back. We were there for three nights over a weekend. What a cool place! The room was incredible. We had a king size suite. It was immaculate and had very up to date modern amenities. The bed was definitely the most comfortable I've been in for a while. We had tons of space for our weekend. We ordered from room service a few times. Coffee in the morning and some snacks in the evening. No complaints there - everything was good, fresh, and brought to the door within 20 minutes by young energetic staff. We found the night club crowd interesting to say the least. We're old enough to parents to most of them, but that's okay. No one gave us a hard time. The elevators were full in the evenings, but we never had to wait to get on. My husband got to know the doormen as he goes out for a smoke frequently. It was kind of neat to home to a line outside the door, and we just had to show our room card and in we went. This place is not for every one... it is very hip and has a New York feel to it. We love it and will definitely be returning. It's time the Delta's and Sheraton's got a run for their money, and this place is giving them just that. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Chic”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyC12
Reviews.Content: Decided to check out this hotel as I had dinner reservations in the area. The Thompson is ultra modern and didn't forget a detail. The rooms are exactly like the pictures and even had windows that opened. We stayed during the week, so there wasn't the noise that other reviewers mentioned. The area is great for walking, shopping and eating. We enjoyed the rooftop patio (indoors in March) and the view is definitely worth the drink price. You are walking distance to the Rogers Centres and I will check this out again for any concerts.

Reviews.Title: “Best modern hotel ever! With heated flooring in bathrom and easy access to lights!”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: If you're driving there be careful with the one way streets. Valet parked my car and the bell boy was helpful. Check-in was easy, prompt, and quick. Everyone was super attentive and friendly upon arrival. My iPad internet didn't work at the work desk, but it did work nearer to the door. I was in a corner room. Luckily, the deskchair had wheels so I could wheel it over. They sent up an engineer "immediately" and to my surprise, he came up 3 minutes later to help me connect. It's about $10/day for internet use. Local calls extra, but there are payphones nearby if you don't want to pay the roaming charges on your cell phone. There are many restaurants on King St, one block north and the hotel has three restaurants attached. I got the hotel as a last minute discount, so for the price, I was very happy. The exercise room is large, spacious, accesible all day with your room key, and has a yogaroom. Would return if opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to decide if it is a nightclub or a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccurtis101
Reviews.Content: Arrived into Toronto on 26th in the PM direct from Australia looking forward to some sleep and relaxtion. Was initially impressed by the decor - how wrong was I. This hotel is apparently the 'party place' in Toronto - it has a nightclub on the top level and is full of underage people who the hotel have apparently allowed to check into the rooms. I witnessed and extremely peeved person who also conveyed the same information to the front of office staff who seemingly could not care less. All night there were EXTREMELY intoxicated people on the level that I was staying (Level 3) and at one stage there were 3 girls who were so pissed that they collapsed on the floor as they could not get into their room which was next to me (check the cameras Thompson and you will see what I mean). There are cameras on each level so the security staff are either not working or could not care less. The fire alarm went off at around 1.45am and then again through to about 2.30am twice. The extremely courteous staff at the Thompson must have thought that alerting the guests to what was happening was a privilege. We received a voice message after the fire department had arrived (some 15 minutes or so after the fire alarm) to tell us that it was a false alarm. The pannicked people at the hotel will attest to the experience and the fact that the staff working need to seriously do some courses on the fire system and what needs to be done to not panic people. Given the fire alarm went off 2 more times through to about 3 in the morning I certainly felt that when I was charged for the night I got my value for money - certainly not !. I will be personally reporting my experience to the fire department in Toronto just so they know what a liability the staff are in keeping the guest assured that all is OK and that the fire alarms are actually false alarms. I travel a lot and have visited Toronto on numerous occasions - my advice is simply pick another hotel. That is unless you want to stay in a nightclub with people extremely pissed, swearing and sleeping in the corridors. Well done Thompson.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location in King/Queen West, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked55
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews I was a little hesitant about booking but was very pleased overall. Bellman desk was always staffed by pleasant individuals who gave me a greeting everytime I entered the hotel. Parking was underground and plentiful. The room was great. Lovely spalike bathroom, no tub but huge shower, all marble and glass, even a phone! Bed very comfortable, wonderful linens. Lots of storage, a computer desk and nicely furnished. Did notice no iron in room. Generally feeling was very cool and modern. Didn't notice too much noise but one night was up late and could hear a distant "throb" of a nightclub. Excellent location for taking in the King/Queen West and Entertainment district scene. Had dinner at nearby Marben restaurant ,hotel coffee shop had excellent breakfast with great service and hotel restaurant always full of happy looking business types.

Reviews.Title: “Still Not Cool Enough to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: RAMGOD
Reviews.Content: Following a poor experience last summer, I decided to give the Thompson another go. Sadly, it's not all that much better. The good: location (A+++ a the the heart of the entertainment district), gym (A+ modern and well lit), bathrooms (A++ modern, great showers). The bad: no in-room coffee (the best in-room coffee in Canada is at the Germain in Calgary, each room has a Nespresso machine!), the Counter restaurant (the dÃ©cor is some bizarre mish-mash of 70 and 80s diner....a little jarring on the nerves after a night out and the food is very average), the staff (the waiter asked if I wanted my Americano with espresso in it!) and finally the bar. The bar at The Thompson is my BIGGEST pet peeve. The roof-top bar is well-guarded and continues to have absurd rules about how many guests hotel patrons may bring. The lobby bar has become a loud and crowded pick-up joint. This hotel missed the sweet spot and could have had a very smart cocktail or whisky bar....instead they opted for bling and some Vegas slash W lite formula. The only reason I may return...an exceptional and engaging concierge by the name of Paula....super, super terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever, not worth the mulah”
Reviews.Author: tomhalls
Reviews.Content: If you want to be overcharged with bad service and musclemen like Oliver and co. who think they can be rude and pushy to patient, paying customers then this is your scene. Make sure to bring a wad of cash so you can pay for entrance to the free club on the bottom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - but...”
Reviews.Author: northerndecorator
Reviews.Content: The new Thompson Hotel in Toronto is really quite a beautiful place. The outside of the building is very unique in the way it uses reflective glass to cover a good portion of the structure...it definitely catches your attention. The lobby has a neat vibe to it and although it is dark, it feels warm and inviting. The guest rooms are bright, super clean and nicely decorated. I especially liked the heated bathroom floors, the great shower and sink, and the comfty bed and pillows. There is a comfortable chair in the room, a counter for incidentals, a mini bar and a flat screen tv just to name a few things that add to the overall ambience. The only complaint we had was the reception upon entering the hotel was very cold and impersonal to say the least. It was our first time at the hotel and although we only stayed one night, we do stay in hotels in Toronto several times every year. The front desk clerk was talking to a friend when we got there and the friend stepped aside when she was checking us in. It was all she could do to give us our key...no 'welcome to the hotel' or any other type of greeting, I would be hard pressed to even say that she said hello to us. I am not looking for much here ...just a word or two would have made a huge difference. The next morning when we checked out it was a different person and she was interested in how our stay was and she was very pleasant. I would recommend this hotel and would go back, but if the same thing happened I don't think I would return for a third time. Thank you for reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience with highs and lows.”
Reviews.Author: Blubble
Reviews.Content: I find that most people here only feel moved to offer reviews in response to extraordinarily good or extraordinarily bad experiences, and so I decided to offer one in response to a stay that was neither, hoping it might offer a little more balanced objectivity to those who are considering this hotel... The good- Location. Walking distance to many restaurants, shops, clubs and services, and all in an exciting urban neighbourhood that gives off a very strong vibe as a cool, creative and up-and-coming area of the city. If you are staying outside of the downtown core this hotel is without question one of your better bets *if* you're looking for the kind of vibe this neighbourhood has to offer. If you couldn't care less then you'd probably find better value for you buck elsewhere. On-site amenities. We enjoyed dining at the Counter which is open 24 hours which is perfect for a late-night bite after clubbing etc... and lets face it, if you're staying at the Thompson you're probably enjoying a little late-night clubbing, or probably should be.
