And even though there are lots of bars and restaurants nearby you could be excused for not ever leaving the hotel given the other restaurant and bars choices on hand. Although we didn't try the restaurant we did enjoy early-evening cocktails in the roof-top lounge before heading out for the evening. The view here is spectacular and well worth going out of your way for, and even in February when the famed swimming pool is closed. It was fairly calm and quiet at the time we were there but the bar tender tells us it gets quite busy as the evening progresses. We did note, however, that the lobby bar was buzzing. Rooms. The King room we had was spacious, nicely designed and cool, and we didn't experience the noise that others complained about... but then again I always travel with ear plugs 'just in case', especially when staying in a city where traffic, car alarms, and late-night revellers can ruin a night's sleep in even the best of situations. Also, lets face it, if you're looking for peace and quiet the Thompson would probably dissappoint. There is definitely a party atmosphere going on here which is presumably why you would want to be here in the first place. The 'less than good'- The 'Essentials'. I didn't particularly find the bed/pillows very comfortable. The mattress was a little soft and schlumpy for my liking. Also, the occassional chairs in the room were cool, but not very conducive to lounging. The 'Goods'. The staff were very stingey with the bath products and towels, and though the products were very nice they seemed to be 'odds and ends' rather than belonging to the same line. I happen to believe that products should be restocked per person per night. This was not the case... and only two towels for two people? Come on, this is a boutique hotel! The 'Details': There is no bank machine in the hotel. The nearest one was a five minute walk away, which in February during a snow storm is a challenge for those well-coiffed 'hipsters' among us who didn't plan ahead. There is nothing to clean your shoes with! Again, we're talking hipsters and Slushy February weather!! Besides, this is a boutique hotel and should be all about the details. Even 2 star hotels I've stayed in have supplied a shoe-buff pack. ... so all in all does the 'less than good' outweigh the good? I'd probably say 'no', depending on what it is you're looking for: if you are looking for 'white glove' luxury/service or rest & relaxation it is fairly safe to say that this establishment is far more focused on the restau-bar component of their business than it is the hotel component and you will probably be happier elsewhere. If on the other hand you want a vibrant and hip experience in a great area and are willing to overlook some details you will probably be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel that was half finished”
Reviews.Author: Triad_Rookie
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto with a couple of family members to visit a friend. Stayed at this hotel and got a good price with priceline.com. Upon arrival was greeted by polite and VERY good-looking staff (both male and female staff they hired looked like they all came from some model agency). However as soon as we got settled down we realized this hotel is only half finished. There are still a lot of construction going on inside and outside of the hotel, and many services and amenities are not yet available when we stayed there. Our room was clean and everything looked brand new (well, after all, it IS a brand new hotel). Bathroom was over the top, with heated floor! Bed was comfortable. Location was a little bit of a walk from downtown area (took us over 20 minutes to walk to CN tower for dinner) but not terrible. Had their free breakfast, was tasty but choice very limited. Overall we enjoyed our stay but wondering what was the rush to open the hotel for business when lots of stuff was yet to be done. Oh also the wireless internet was not working and they had to send someone to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: randrews11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for one week in December. Woudl definitely recommend this hotel - lots of things to do - Roof Top bar, Scareptta, The Counter, lobby bar and club downstairs. I stayed on the 4th floor and did not encounter any noise at all. My room had a balcony which was nice and the room was immaculately cleaned everyday. Really enjoyed mys tay here and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Toronto. Nicest Thompson in my opinion...

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to like it....”
Reviews.Author: nelsonjj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Thompson from Saturday, December 4 to Thursday, December 9. I generally prefer boutique hotels to the large chains, and Iâ€™ve enjoyed other Thompson hotels. While I really wanted to like this hotel, there are a lot of flaws. Next time Iâ€™m in town, Iâ€™ll be staying elsewhere. Likes: â€¢ Cool up-and-coming location with lots of character. â€¢ Good design â€“ very hip and trendy. â€¢ Awesome heated floors in the bathroom. â€¢ Front desk staff and doormen are great. Dislikes: â€¢ Rooms are ridiculously loud. I heard everything happening in the hall at all times of day and night. I donâ€™t mind a little noise, but this was crazy. They need better doors that actually close out the noise. â€¢ The faux hardwood floors in the rooms look great, but thereâ€™s a reason why most hotels have carpet â€“ noise attenuation. I heard everything in the room above me, including high heels and the bed. â€¢ Total party atmosphere. Didnâ€™t mind it so much on Saturday night, but I was woken up at 3AM on Wednesday night to a loud party in a room down the hall. The party was apparently so loud that one of the girls took the cordless phone out into the hall to place her room service order. I had to call to the front desk to have the party broken up, and even then, there was still a lot of noise from down the hall. â€¢ I returned Wednesday night at about 10PM â€“ I hadnâ€™t been back to the room since I left at 8:30AM. To my shock, my door was ajar! It wasnâ€™t closed. Nothing was missing from the room, but this seriously wasnâ€™t cool. I called the GM, who apologized. â€¢ I had a German beer mug in the room that I got from a conference event early in the week. It obviously wasnâ€™t a hotel glass, as it had the conference name on it. I know it was in the room, as I remember using it as a water glass one night. When I checked out Thursday morning, I realized it was missing. Iâ€™m sure the maid picked it up, and its in the kitchen somewhere. â€¢ Wireless internet is REALLY weak. I had to get a CATV cable from the front desk to plug my computer into the jack at the desk, which meant I had to do all my work from the desk. Not a big problem, but the desk is built into a wall of cabinetry, and I banged my head twice on the overhead cabinets. â€¢ I really wanted to like the coffee shop, but nothing was really that good. The coffee was downright horrible. I like the taste of strong coffee and usually drink it black, but this stuff was horrible. There isn't enough cream or sugar that could mask the fowl taste of this crap. â€¢ The beds are just so-so. I think they are memory foam. They feel spongy--not exactly firm. I prefer a Westin Heavenly bed or the awesome beds at Sofitels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: matley1304
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Thompson for one night and as I had booked it through priceline wasnt sure what to expect. However, I have to say that I was particularly impressed. The room was massively spacious and presented in a modern contemporary manner. I was lucky enough also to have a view of the CN Tower from my room. If you dont have a view though the rooftop terrace makes up for it as the views of the cityscape are stunning! Expect to pay 4* prices but as its located only half a mile from the CN Tower and downtown areas its a price that is worth paying especially if you want to stay in style.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: cflavoured
Reviews.Content: I am honestly shocked by the other poor ratings of this hotel. The reviews had me second guessing our decision to spend our wedding night here but luckily, I had nothing to worry about. This was easily one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. To start off, we were given a free upgrade to a King Suite with an early check in and late check out. The room was incredible in every way. It was enormous with a living room, extra large bathroom, soaker tub, shower with a rain head and cozy bed. All the lights and everything in the room can be controlled from bedside switches. It was impeccably clean to boot. I'm not sure what the noise complaints are about... we faced Bathurst St, which is a busy street and couldn't hear a thing. We also spent a Friday night here and didn't hear a peep from other rooms, the bar area or anything. We ordered room service, which was a huge portion and delicious. It was a little expensive but considering the portion size, we felt it was worth the price. We don't typically stay in hotels this nice and maybe the upgrade made us love this place but I honestly couldn't find anything wrong with this place. This is an awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: PinchyBoobmar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on business and had a really enjoyable stay! The room was comfortable and clean and stylish. The purpose of my stay was for business so it was a little disappointing when I found that the WIFI was not free and a little slow. However everything else was great, the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. Food was not bad, I ordered room service most nights due to a lot of late nights but the choice was pretty decent on and not too bad for the price, service was always quick. I didn't have a chance to use the but I did go up and have a look at the gym and sauna and I just wish i had more time to have actually used them.

Reviews.Title: “Just went for drinks...and a dose of incompetence”
Reviews.Author: baltar
Reviews.Content: Pretentious, doesn't begin to describe this place... My wife and I thought we'd walk down King St. and maybe have a drink or two and see what all the hub-bub was regarding this place... "Toronto's top new hotel", "Site of Toronto's International Film fest hangout..." etc. When we got to the bar (which is interestingly enough, laid out quite well with original stick-painting style murals on the back wall and black throughout), we ended up sitting on the far side of the half empty bar not more than five feet from three chatting servers. Five minutes later, we still didn't have menus. After eventually getting the (very) pricey drink menu list (18 to 20 for a cocktail), we settled on a "pint" of beer each (7 a piece)........ and waited.......and then, waited. Finally, our bartendress appeared, and began pulling our pint (well, not exactly a pint, she told us it was a pint when we initially ordered, but when it came time to put glass to beer, it turned out to be a smaller glass that only held 12 oz's). As I watched her fill the glass, she began to complain to her co-worker that the keg must be running low, as it was just frothing with very little beer coming out (all the beer handles just happened to right in front of my wife and I, so our view was unobstructed and up-close and personal of the developing situation). I continued to watch, and she continued to pour , complain, and scalp the foam off the top of the glass. Finally in frustration she gave up with the little glass at about 3/4's full, and handed to me... saying, "Your Keith's Sir..." After 3 gulps from me, 5 for my wife, we were finished and ready to depart. The server then asked for a credit card, to which I replied, "I just gave it to you - when we ordered the beer..." An exasperated look followed, then some rummaging around, and finally a request for another credit card from her........ As I was about to blow my top another server held up a credit card on the other side of the bar and announced to her cohorts, "Who's is this...?" To which I replied, "It's mine...." More looks of exasperation from the servers and finally I was able to sign my credit card and way out of the bar. P.S. I counted a total of 4 bartendresses, and 4 wait staff - total number of people at the bar... 11 (including my wife and myself). P.P.S. I didn't stay at the hotel so I can't comment on that... although I have my suspicions!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD, LOUD, LOUD”
Reviews.Author: Calico610
Reviews.Content: Major sound problems! First room was located near the elevators and the loud dinging from the elevator kept me up all night. Staff was very nice and moved me to a room very far from the elevator but then the loud people in the hallway kept me up all night. This hotel might do better business renting by the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel with wonderful concierge!”
Reviews.Author: kiwiinlg
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the other reviews that compare the service at the Thompson to a "cheesy mall". This was not my experience. In fact, Paula at the concierge desk provided my sister and I with warm, welcoming and unbridled attention! She was so helpful, patient and informative. While the hotel is new and stylish, it was her personal attention that separated it from many other upscale hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: lucy228
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night before and the night of our wedding. I thought the hotel was beautiful. I loved the design and the rooms were very comfortable and nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only major problem we had was that you could hear every little noise in the hallway. I am a pretty good sleeper, but I was kept awake with our neighbours ordering room service and the elevator dinging every 5 minutes. My parents stayed at a hotel facing the highway and they heard less noise than us. It is a beautiful place, but if you are going to stay, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy dive....”
Reviews.Author: Palpatine
Reviews.Content: Never again, the management is shameless and has not spent a minute training their staff. My room was poorly cleaned, fitlthy hallways, staff busy chit- chatting and wont pay attention to guests at the front desk- Was planning on holding a 4 days staff meeting at the hotel- Guess what? I will be taking my business somewhere else. Another "trendy" hotel with the illusion they can survive on being trendy and hip. Once they realize the week end crowds are not enough to help them survive they will start paying attention to the business traveller. Go spend your company's money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “chic and trendy, but has major problems”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: The Thompson has a modern chic decor and is staffed by beautiful people who dress to impress (almost all in black, in keeping with the decor). But they need more training in service. Check-in was difficult, because of an error that should have been easy to correct, but the woman at the front desk didn't want to believe I was staying two nights. Finally, she said ok (they weren't overbooked) but then called my room later to say she checked and found others in my group were leaving after one night, so she cancelled the second night. Finally the group organizer straightened it out, but my key still stopped working at an inconvenient time in the middle of the next day. The room was mostly fine, but they had all the extra charges for internet, "toll free" calls, all other calls, ect. There were more serious problems. The meeting room looked fine, until a ceiling tile fell down with a rather loud sound. Fortunately, there was a large horizontal beam that stopped its fall. Had a different tile fallen, someone could have been seriously hurt. Then there are the doors to the rooms. As with most hotel room doors, they start to close by themselves, but they don't quite make it. Each time I came and went, I had to remember to close it all the way. I noticed a few other doors in the morning were not fully closed, so it wasn't just my room. The hotel is VERY noisy, possibly because of the decor or possibly because of the very young noisy crowd. Finally, when my meeting ended and I wanted to check out the famous roof pool, it was closed 4pm-2am for a private function. Maybe with time, the staff will be trained and flaws in the building will be fixed, but for now--Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Vangroove
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with the value; noise rooms, front desk forgot my second wakeup call twice, service at the bar was terrible, restaurant food was ok, but small for the price and they never had tables for hotel guests, paid 390 a night, NOT WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “For a new hotel, this place sure is a mess!”
Reviews.Author: iman100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Thompson for almost three weeks while on business. The only good thing I can say about it is that it is in the Kings West area which is full of life - restaurants, coffee shops, markets, etc. The bars and restaurants in the lobby are hopping and nice though over-priced. The room is very modern and nearly useless. There's no coffee machine. If you want ice -- you have to call room service - there are no ice machines. The one time I did, it took an hour to come up. The shower is one of those "rain" head showers. Imagine lathering up your hair, then standing in a drizzle outside to get the shampoo out and you've got the idea. I ordered room service one night. An hour later I called down -- they forgot to bring it up. The hallway, though only a few months old, is all scuffed up, the carpet worn almost through. The floor in the hall is always dirty. The maid service seems to only make the bed and change the towels. Rings on the table from glasses are never wiped off, the sink still has toothpaste stains. One of the two elevators was broken for days. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss...”
Reviews.Author: Loves_good_things
Reviews.Content: First just let me say that there are some things that I liked about this hotel and others that annoyed me. I think the decision to stay here really depends on your age and the kind of hotel stay you prefer (we like hotels that focus on being a hotel, more than a hot spot). If you're a young couple wanting to be in a "nightclub style environment" with your hotel in the center of it and you have a decent budget than this is the place for you (the rooms weren't too expensive, but the incrementals can add up fast)! First impression (during the day) is that it's quite slick, nicely decorated and the service was good, quick & friendly. At night the doorman (a different guy from earlier) seemed more like a bouncer and was texting and swearing when we pulled up, which made us feel like we were staying at a nightclub more than a hotel. (It seemed like they did casting calls for most of their staff instead of "hiring"- however some of the front desk & day staff were the exception). They seemed to put a lot of effort into the style of the decor and less on the functionality. I wish they would have tested some of their "design touches" first before choosing style over usefulness. Stylish but impractical things include: the bathroom sink - huge and splashy, the lighting system - didn't work properly and turning on the bathroom light illuminates the whole room (argh!), no shower door - looks good, but is drafty, rain shower head - again, looks good, but is useless for women who don't want to wet their hair every time (I eventually asked for a shower cap, as one was not provided), and the black out blinds & curtains- light came in from above and in between. Also, there was a general lack of space to put stuff (especially in the bathroom due to the huge sink), plus our front door didn't close properly and needed to be pulled tightly shut. Pros included the stylish decor (minus the impractical things), bed was comfy, hypo allergenic bedding was available and still comfortable, Wobara sushi restaurant was delicious (even though it was just opened and they didn't even have their liquor license yet!) and the location. King West is an amazing location and as a former Toronto resident I have to say that the shops and restaurants around the Thompson are excellent! Pet peeves were: They only provided 2 towels and 1 bathrobe in a room for 2 with a King Bed, no slippers, only 4 hangers and no bathroom "extras" like Qtips, shower caps, sewing kit, etc. However I will mention that when I called down to request most of the above, they brought it to us fairly promptly (although I still feel like they should have been there automatically). Also, we had a corner room and half of our windows were covered in white vinyl, so the view was lost - which really was a shame. I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the rooftop patio which is cool, with a gorgeous pool and has a great views of the city. But be warned the drinks are really expensive (a round of 4 vodka tonics was $53 - BEFORE TIP) and again the "bouncer-like attitude" is quite prevalent. Last mentions - the breakfast in The Counter (diner style), was OK - a little bland and nothing great (better options on King), parking was $35/night (which is crazy - for that price I felt like they should have included a car wash, at least), and the blinds really should be electric - the incremental cost/room should have been justified and they could do without the difficult to maneuver curtains and pulley blinds. Overall, now that you're read my review (thank you for doing so) - I suppose I'd recommend this hotel if you can get a deal and if you don't sweat the small stuff. The location is fantastic and if you can avoid the bouncer-like attitudes, pricey drinks and parking, you can have quite a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like in a prision!”
Reviews.Author: ernest155019
Reviews.Content: I want to have a drink at the bar upstairs and the 'roof top' manager says I can't go and have to go back to my room. Apparently they reached capacity and if you are a guest, you have to go downstairs to the lobby and make a line to go up again and have a drink like any regular Joe. In the meantime, the bouncers are letting the 'hot girls' (who are clearing walking out from the street and are not guests) to cross the velvet rope and go upstairs to the roof. This is like a prision and want to get out of here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, amazing service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: daleeper
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Starwood Ws or very modern type hotels so I was looking forward to the Thompson. I had seen an article about Toronto in the NYTimes and there was a great photo of the hotel's rooftop pool plus information on how the neighborhood was kind of like the Meatpacking district, old stuff and new stuff..which I really like. The hotel is super new and clean. The staff was very helpful and went above my experience with other hotels. On my first night, one of the hotel clerks, Stephanie, sent room service with chocolate covered cherries with shaved white chocolate plus hot tea and to top that off a very nice note saying that she hoped I recovered from my travel day. (it was a very long day!). How sweet was that? I immediately felt better and the cherries were amazing. The only problem I had was resolved very quickly. My room was right next to an elevator so when I was trying to sleep I kept being awaken by people getting on and off the elevator. (everyone sounded really happy but really loud) Around 2am I was upgraded to another room and slept great. The Kings suite has a large bathroom, with tub and shower, plus a small living room and bedroom. The beds are really comfy. I only tried one restaurant in the hotel but it was perfect, The Counter, great comfort food and if you pick right, it seems healthy. Room Service was very fast too. Also, there is great shopping near by on Queen St. It reminded me a little bit of Haight Ashbury. There is also a great hot yoga studio half a block away. My room was only $149.00 a night and I have paid $400 or above for the equivalent. This was such a deal! perfection.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: epicurean42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 15th anniversary and wanted to do something special. We decided to stay in our city, Toronto and spend the night at a hotel. We stayed at the Thompson Toronto, and I can't wait to go back. The service was impeccable: from the bellman who held my bags while I checked in to the girl at the tuck shop who helped me pick out gifts for my children on my way out. The room was, in a word opulant. We had a King suite which was immaculate and luxurious. We had one of the most memorable dinners I've ever had at Scarpetta. The pasta was homemade and delicious, and the dessert - chocolate cake was gooey and delicious. , Drinks on the rooftop was an experience I will not soon forget. I ordered breakfast from room service in the morning the service was speedy, and the eggs benedict incredible. I topped my stay off with lunch at the counter which, like all my meals at the Thompson was excellent - I had the grilled veggie sandwich. As to the location - it was convenient, but I really didn't explore the King West area because everything I needed was in the hotel! I can't wait until my birthday so I can have an excuse to stay at the Thompson again! Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: I'd love this place if I wanted to party all night, I really would. The rooms are clean and contemporary, the bar's nice, the restaurant is good and the staff is friendly and helpful. However, with doors slamming and guests yelling in the hallways, I needed the assistance of pharmacologicals and ear plugs in order to fall asleep. It didn't matter that I changed rooms, there were noise issues on both floors that I stayed on. If the potential for noise doesn't bother you, go for it. I think you'll enjoy your stay. The hotel itself is nice, the surrounding neighbourhood has a ton of interesting shops, restaurants and bars, so there's plenty to do. My only other comments, for what it's worth, there appears to be a little wear and tear in the hallways. Also, the hotel may want to consider adjusting the door closers. That may help eliminate some of the noise associated with pulling the doors shut. Other than that, the property is maintained nicely and has some cool design elements. If I could have gotten a good night sleep, I'd be able to rate the hotel higher from a value standpoint. Special thanks to hotel associates Martina, Shanna and James. You guys are great, I appreciate your help with the issues that I had.

Reviews.Title: “On the road to being a very good hotel...but not quite there yet”
Reviews.Author: Bruce_and_John
Reviews.Content: We spent the July long weekend at the Thompson as part of a staycation here in Toronto. Overall we had a really good stay, but as has been mentioned here several times, they were pretty obviously working through some opening jitters. We have a description of the whole experience with photos at our blog: http://bobofeed.blogspot.com/2010/07/fab-week-ends-of-summer2-staycation.html We found the staff 100% friendly & courteous- never a hint of condescension. The premises are quite stunning. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a suite & it was beautiful; it felt like an actual apartment. Two points worth noting, however: in the bathroom, the shower (large & comfortable) had a full width, full height glass window looking right into the bedroom. For any couples where there are modesty issues, this could be a problem. The biggest concern for us was that when using the facilities at night the light flooded the bedroom. Second point: the kitchen, which was full of modern cabinets, a full size refrigerator, and had a nearby dining table, came equipped with 2 wine glasses & a corkscrew and 2 drinking glasses. That was it. Not a spoon, not a little plate. We though this was a big negative strike. Sure, they want you to use room service, but it's a suite for goodness' sake. It just seemed stingy. Aside from these things we found the quality of the room to be exceptional. The main dining room wasn't open yet when we were there but we ate in the coffee shop, which was quite good. The rooftop lounge & pool are the hotel's big drawing card, at least in this first summer season. The area is cool & sexy, but suffers from its popularity. During the hot weekend afternoons the pool deck was very crowded & we're led to believe that this is in part because condo owners in the building have access. We managed to snag a couple of chairs & a table & had a nice afternoon but it was a twenty-something party atmosphere, which may put some off. We returned both evenings and had a blast. Great music, good drinks, again very friendly service despite the cool factor, very attractive crowd and a stunning skyline view! Our only reason for grading the cleanliness a little low was that there were still a few construction deficiencies. We had baggies over our smoke alarms to keep the drywall dust out, there were a few paint daubs where they shouldn't be and a carpet tile outside our door had a big stain on it. Housekeeping cleanliness was first rate, though. In fact we had twice daily maid service. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Thompson and would recommend it to others. We look forward to trying the now-open Scarpetta, the hotel's main dining room, at some point soon. And it will be fun to return again for another weekend stay, maybe in the middle of winter for a completely different vibe, to see how things have progressed.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Staff; Poor Leadership”
Reviews.Author: jordancorp
Reviews.Content: This review focuses on hotel staff and services, apart from the hotel rooms themselves (which I had to rate anyway, to submit this review) In short, some staff are experienced pros while others are under-trained and under-managed incompetents. These highs and lows of service throughout the hotel are baffling and frustrating. I hosted a casual pre-night-out dinner at The Counter (upscale diner) in the hotel (because the hotel couldn't or wouldn't figure out how to serve any food beyond nuts, dips and olives on the Rooftop Terrace/Lounge where we were headed afterwards for drinks). From first drink order to first appearance of anything in a glass - 35 minutes -- even after two polite promptings of the restaurant manager to speed things up. The waiter was so clueless, we had to point to items on the menu, which he had obviously never read before. Food was satisfactory for 'diner food'. In the few months since opening, the Thompson has tried to establish itself as the latest, best and most exclusive of the hip/chic downtown Toronto hotels. It has cultivated that image through forward (although variably vacant, hard and under-lit) interior design of public spaces, coupled with ultra restrictive access to its Rooftop Terrace (and its spectacular downtown views). Unless the leadership of this hotel provides some clear direction as to what their brand stands for and the service/competence levels required to work there, it'll be a big flop, at least locally.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent experience at the Thompson”
Reviews.Author: FunLuvTravel
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading all of the negative reviews about this hotel. I have to say that we had an absolutely excellent experience at this hotel. We travel often both for business and well as leisure. We have stayed in many high end hotels and consider Thompson to be one of them. I called the day before and requested early check in. They were very and pleasant and granted us our request. Most hotels will not guarantee this when you call. We arrived earlier than requested and they immediately helped us to our room. Everyone at the hotel both staff and guests were extremely friendly and helpful. We traveled with an infant and people always held the elevator or door for us. The roof top pool was beautiful. Both days we had no problem finding lounge chairs. We asked for a late check out and were granted that as well. We called for additional towels and in less than five minutes they arrived at our room. The only down side to the roof top was we were informed it was closed at 5pm for a private party. They did however let us know this as soon as we checked in and we were not rushed out when we ordered drinks at 4:30. It also can be a little loud when doors in the hallway are closed especially late at night. However I have stayed in many four star hotels and been given the room across from the ice maker or by the elevator. Sometimes sounds in a hotel cannot be helped. We found the location to be perfect for our needs. We were just seconds away from Lee restaurant where we had an amazing dinner. The lobby bar lounge was also very nice with plenty of seating. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. We have stayed at the Hazelton before and I was much happier paying $175 a night vs. $500. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. It made for a perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious week-end”
Reviews.Author: Always_on_the_road35
Reviews.Content: We were a bit wary after reading the reviews, especially given that we'd be travelling with our 19 month-old son. However, the staff, from the bellmen through to the servers at the rooftop bar, was gracious and warm. We definitely did not fit in with the other clientele but the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were upgraded to a larger room, which was very luxurious and well-laid out. Breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel was reasonably priced and open 24 hours a day, useful when your baby gets up at 6AM. We normally stay closer downtown but found we liked the hotelâ€™s location. The one, minor, flaw was that there was no place to hang our towels outside the shower and no bathmat. We weren't able to exit the shower without getting water all over the marble floor, which made for a rather slippery start to our morning. I expect the hotel will be out of our price range very shortly as they are obviously starting to get their act together from a service perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor - all around”
Reviews.Author: MajesticUsa
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in Toronto, DO NOT stay at Thompson. Besides the poor location and cold facilities, the staff is completely incompetent. Friends sent me a special amenity to be delivered to my room, which they confirmed twice with the hotel - did not receive it until they called the 3rd time. Concierge claimed restaurant selected for dinner was booked solid - walked to the restaurant and was sat immediately. Recommendations and directions for places to eat and visit were not at all what was requested. Front Desk - as cold as the furnishings. Very automated and not at all customer centric. For the cost of the hotel, F/B, etc...stay somewhere else! There is truly no reason to stay at Thompson unless you're looking for an unpleasant, clueless staff in a poor part of town.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone_Bone
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor will not allow me to use the word I need to describe the people at this hotel. So let me try and help you guess. The second word is BAG

Reviews.Title: “The Trickle-down Affect: Poor Manager = Poor Staff Quality + Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: synergy_10
Reviews.Content: The Thompson Hotel, in Toronto, has a long way to go before it can match its interior depth (or lacking thereof), to that of it's exterior facade. Right now all it can offer and boast for itself is a pretty hotel and pretty staff. That's about it. What it's lacking is friendly, reliable, knowledgeable, experienced staff and manager, who understand the meaning, and how to go about executing, excellent and satisfactory customer service. Perhaps the hotel management thinks it's enough to cash in on the youthfulness of the very young staff, without proper experience and training under their belt. And the pretentious receptionists and guest services staff, who think they can get by on their looks, and don't need to smile, be friendly and engaging, just end up coming across as immature high school students who think they're too cool for school. It wasn't hard to see why and how this dysfunction came to be when we engaged with the manager and realized she was an elitist, incompetent and grumpy sourpuss (I'm trying to keep it polite). Apparently, the day we were there, she rented access to certain areas of the hotel (including the front lobby), to a film crew, to film a pilot of "Alphas," for the day. The problem was, she didn't even bother to inform her staff, condo tenants, or hotel guests of any of this. The staff were not briefed as to this temporary disruption, or were they prepared on how to handle it, or how to address the guests in order to alleviate any undue stress on their part. The manager didn't notify the guests, prepare an alternate entrance, an alternate registration depot, or alternate exit, in order to maintain a smooth and professional operation, while still accommodating the film crew who payed big bucks and had a contract and a permit allowing them access to the hotel and immediate street area. Instead, it seems, the manager presented nothing but a bad attitude and an unprofessional demeanor, as she continually tried to kick the actors off the sofas, out of the lobby, and on to the street, as they were trying to work. It seems the production's location rental money was good enough for her to pocket , but the actors and crew were not good enough for the sofas and lobby of this stuck-up manager and hotel. The staff commented to us on their surprise when they came to work that day, only to discover a film being made, and nobody bothered to tell them. They also commented that the manager thought it would be a small, unassuming, in-and-out film shoot. First of all, there is no such thing as a small, unassuming, in-and-out film shoot - they're always huge and long productions, of at least fourteen hour days. No harm in not knowing that, but if you rent out a new and busy condo and hotel to a film crew, I'd think you'd do your homework, ask some questions and be prepared - at least a little bit. But to do nothing at all, and to not tell your staff, or your patrons, and then to deflect the blame on to the crew and performers (who payed you good money for the right to be there), when you are the only one to blame, well, that puts everything else that is wrong with this hotel in to perspective for me. For the staff to be mature, responsible, professional and friendly, then their chief commander has to possess all of those qualities first. It is a trickle-down affect, after all, whenever there is poor management, there will always be poor staff quality and customer service. I was shocked and surprised by what I had seen, heard and experienced at this hotel on the film shoot day, and frankly, I feel sorry for customers who will be short-changed of a better experience when they bed here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, head to toe!!”
Reviews.Author: wahler1979
Reviews.Content: If you're under 40, you've probably found your new home away from home. As a Torontonian I can appreciate when things are above & beyond, especially in our own city and Thompson Hotel qualifies! They thought of every detail from their gorgeous lobby wall mural to the stunning rooftop lounge. Head to toe this hotel is sexy. We checked in for a weekend getaway and were welcomed by the handsome bellhop at the curb who took our bags in for us. The front desk girls were all very friendly and nice and our arrival was smooth. They recommended the 24 hour diner that's just off from the lobby, which we checked out later that night. Cute atmosphere, great uniforms on the staff (levis and converse!) and the food was great if slightly overpriced. The bar in the lobby was pretty dead for most of our stay, but the rooftop was packed and clearly the place to be. Hotel guests were allowed a plus one only, but that was fine with us. Drinks were a bit steep, but you're drinking in the sky so I guess it works out? This is hands down the best view of TO I've ever seen. The bartenders up top were slammed and a bit curt, but pretty. You can clearly tell Thompson Hotel's main focus is "pretty" for everything. Our room service was delivered by a charming model in rayban wayfarer glasses and a bow tie.. they nailed all the details they could. Our room was a decent size, similar to a bachelor apt without the kitchen. Lots of warm wood with orangey red accents. King size bed, a-mazing duvet and linens. The windows ran from the ground to the ceiling but some were glazed over so we couldn't see the whole "city view" we signed up for. Still very stylish with hardwood floors. No noise issues (which was a concern, staying at an alleged party hotel.) Of course there are a few glitches because the hotel is still new. The elevators require a room key to move from floor to floor so we ended up going on a few elevator rides up and down if we weren't fast enough with our room key card. Security presence in the hotel's lobby seemed excessive, like they were running a night club or something. We weren't bothered because we had our hotel keys to show we were guests. Our internet (which was 10 dollars each day) kept screwing up and housekeeping forgot to service our room altogether one day, but we spoke with the front desk manager Kristine and she helped fix our problems. This hotel will be THE place to be once they get all the details sorted. If you're going, be patient and realize the bargain you're getting when you stay. This is a five star hotel and we paid less than $250 each night! Give it time, Thompson Hotel will be TO's answer to a perfect weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: After reading numbers of negative reviews, I was worried about staying at this hotel. But all wasn't that bad, much better then I expect it to be. The Thompson Toronto has lots of potential to grow into a great hotel. Itâ€™s funky, edgy and very cool but still maintains a very comfortable feel for such a trendy hotel. Was my stay perfect â€“ no, not by any means. But then again this is a brand new hotel, which only opened two months ago. So you have to give this hotel a break for now. The location of the Thompson is great, close to downtown but still far enough from the craziness of the downtown core. Upon entering the lobby, it has a very cool yet warm feel â€“ I loved the unique lighting effects at night. Lots of cozy lounge areas with a great bar scene at night. Check-in took way to long, but then again, I did come in early. Staff where friendly and helpful, but nothing special. Bellman people looked somewhat lost in what they were doing. I had a great corner room with a good view of the CN Tower and park below. What was odd though, 80% off my room windows had no view and had an odd frosting-like film on all the windows, except for the one with a view. Like another member mentioned, this is weird and somewhat disappointing. I would hope this is only a temporary thing that the hotel is doing. The curtains where also extremely annoying to open and close. In this day and age, for such a cutting edge hotel â€“ you should be able to have automated control over the curtains and drapes. It felt very old school having to menially open and close the drapes, since there was so much of them. Again, not a big deal but something to pick at, since 90% of the room had windows â€“ witch I loved too. Bed was very comfortable and cozy. Good pillows too. Bathroom was nice, but nothing special and had no tub of any kind. Good size shower and the bathroom had a light and airy feel. Great bath products, thanks to C.O Bigalow from NY. Now the best thing by far about this hotel, the crown and jewel was the amazing pool deck. Incredible views, lounging areas and off the course, the pool. Loved it, the crowd was somewhat pretentious but the bar staff where friendly and cheery. Did I mention the views where stunning! This is why I really wanted to stay at this hotel. Lastly, the all-day resto I dined at for breakfast was fun and again cool, but nothing special. Service was spotty and food was not as hot as it could have been. So the diner was just okay to me. The only thing that was really disappointing, for a city hotel of this quality â€“ the issue of street noise from your room. It was pretty bad. I could even here the noise from the hallways, other rooms next door and even the elevator chime. Very annoying! I think with time, this hotel will do well for its self. But the noise issue is a true disappointment. So come for one night to experience the rooftop pool and lounge and then maybe move to a better hotel with better noise control. Would I stay here again? Maybe - but only in the summer, because of the rooftop deck and pool. I still want to try the Drake Hotel on Queen Street, which Iâ€™ve heard is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “The new hotspot”
Reviews.Author: Belgiantravellover
Reviews.Content: Brand new design hotel a few weeks open. There is still a few things happen workmanship. Beautiful rooms (limited visibility due to the presence of milk glass over 2 / 3 of the window, pity), staff is friendly. Beautiful lobby / bar. Very nice rooftop pool, but very small for this hotel just 12 sun-beds, although very comfortable beds. The bar next to the pool looks fantastic especially at night by the beautiful view over the city. This is certainly the greatest asset of the hotel. Can only be visited by hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Fail: All Style, No Substance”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: Reservations: easily made on line Check-in: "Ummm...I can't find your rate...do you have a print out of your reservation?" I AM NOT KIDDING. Fortunately, I did have a print out. This is a hotel first. Bad Omen: Going up to the room in the elevator, another guest saw us checking in. He said "Good luck. I have reserved 5 rooms for 7 days and I am cancelling and moving out. This place is terrible." Room: modern stylish and large, with two very comfortable beds, flat screen TV, large well appointed bathroom......until the shower handle fell off in my hand while in the middle of shower, taking me 10 minutes with the water pouring down to get it back on and turn off the shower. Oh...and the floors in the room were covered with dust and dirt and obviously hadn't been swept or vacuumed at check-in. AND....it took two calls to get housekeeping to come up to clean the floors. AND....when we returned on Sunday evening from at wedding at 10 pm our room had not been serviced.....AND, the walls are paper thin and half the guests think that 3 am is party time, with yelling and screaming in the room above us on Sunday night....AND my mother and sister had to call the desk four times at 3 am on Saturday night due to a party on their floor...which was did not subside until the police arrived. Or when I asked for my car from the front desk and instead of saying "Five minutes or "Thank you it will be right up" they just hung up the telephone after I gave them the valet ticket number. Complaint Resolution: Manager #1: "Oh......what is your room rate....I will see what I can do." WHAT IS MY ROOM RATE? WHAT DOES THAT HAVE TO DO WITH DIRTY ROOMS THAT AREN'T READY FOR OCCUPANCY, NOISE, SHOWER HANDLES THAT FALL OFF, SHODDY SERVICE, ETC?" Manager #2: "I am very sorry". And she took two meals off of our restaurant bill and gave us free internet and moved my mother and sister to another room. Stephanie is a pro. Check out: Fast and efficient "Did you enjoy your stay?" NO!!!!!! This is a very stylish flashy hotel in a great downtown location. The staff look good but is young and some are poorly trained. The bell men are wonderful. The rooms are large but not quiet at all. The roof deck is great. The fitness center is large and well appointed. The hotel diner offers good food and mediocre service. The hotel service experience is terrible. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to sleep or be served”
Reviews.Author: UpintheAir1962
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival home from a trip overseas, my wife surprised me with a get away in the City, the Thompson Hotel. She was excited by the prospect of being downtown, enjoying the rooftop pool and then dinner at the new Scarpetta. Well, as much as the hotel is designed to be chic and has many interesting touches, it is not the place to stay over night. The entire hotel is done in a dark hardwood (engineered hardwood?) floor and as a result every little noise echos and magnifies and there is no hope for a quite sleep. We arrived at check-in and at best the staff is there too look good rather than be good, many lessons could be learned if they took walk over to the four seasons and see what service really means. We got in the room and 90% of the windows are frosted with no hope of seeing where you are. No wonder that when my wife had requested a City view, they said that there wasn't one available. We overlooked this and headed to the roof for lunch and the pool. Well, hello beautiful bodies, young women walking around strutting their stuff but no one in the pool and unfortunately us 50 year olds certainly weren't going to be first. Lunch finally came, were did order a bottle of vodka, so i guess we weren't that important. Dinner at Scarpetta was okay but this was only night 2 so i can assume it will get better but based on the wine list, better wait a few years....very few bottles were older than an 07 and nothing much from new world....almost all italians, which is usually good but not when they are so young. Servers were nervous to screw up and as a result they did....they will improve. Back to the rooftop to check out the view of the city at night .... beautiful .... dont stay unless you are under 35, single and believe that you are exceptionally beautiful and wont to get drunk. Off to bed at 11:30pm but couldn't sleep because of the noise in the halls, slamming doors, partying and obnoxious guests. 4:30am finally asleep and then awoken with a loud bang...."room service"....what the heck, went to check and it was for the gang just down the hall. There is hope but this hotel needs to decide what it wants to be when it grows up and who its real clients are.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the downfall of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eennag
Reviews.Content: A colleague of mine suggested for me to stay at Thompson Toronto the hotel is locate in downtown west and used to be the fashion district. The lobby was impressive and the doorman who helped me with my luggage was very pleasant and engaging. The front desk agent had a poker face and really was not welcoming. The room is very spacious loved the bed and the bathrooms are well appointed. On my first night, I woke up at 5AM by noise coming from the room next door. I called the front desk a few times to advise them of the noise and finally on the third call the agent asked me if he can come into my room and listen to my wall because he wasnt sure if it was the right room I was complaining about. In the end they had to move the guests next door. The AC didn't work a few times, called Engineering and he answered the phone" Hey". The rooftop is amazing, the food was decent, tried the pool but you have to get there early bec the lounge chairs are very limited and space is really small. Some guests just laid on the floor with their towels which is ridiculous. Went up at night with some clients, I was advised by the hostess I can only bring one guests why??? I'm a guest and I would like to entertain clients... I just ignored her and walked in. I can go on and on with so many issues....... My advise to management is train your staff no matter how beautiful your facilities are the backbone and success rest on the staff.. They are the one's that make stays unforgettable....

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Thompson Rooftop Patio but NEVER STAY THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: UNO_10
Reviews.Content: All in all a terrible experience. Where do I start? The worst is probably the staff who have are clueless on how to provide upscale service. The service at Thompson Toronto emulates a shopping mall clothing store or a cheesy club, not an upscale hotel or establishment. The staff doesnt go that extra mile and do not understand how to truly defer to their patrons. They are not prepared for the jet-set clientele who will quickly be annoyed with this place. They are good at answering your complaints though. But employees must verify everything. You want to enter the rooftop patio? Let me see your card. You have comped drinks? Let me check that. Its as if you are attending a low-scale nightclub for 19 year olds. There is a subtlety to upscale service which I dont think Thompson Toronto has mastered. For folks who are accustom to upscale service or hotels, stay far far away. Id even recommend holiday inn over this place in terms of customer service. You quickly become annoyed with the staff, who do try, but are just not equipped with the right level of deference to their customers. The elevators require you to use to enter your room key which leads to all kinds of frantic behavior when jumping on or else you end up on the wrong floor. Very annoying. They were bugs/spiders in the hotel room, on the ceiling and on the walls. They were even the remnants of dead bugs on the walls and cielings. They were all kinds of missed details. Like a single robe rather than two in the rooms. The experience at Thompson Toronto feels nothing like a relaxed resort or chill atmosphere of the Ws, Gaanesvoort, Shore Club, Venetian etc. It feels like the opposite - a total hassle. The staff seem confused and have no clue about how to serve their customers. They do try but they are just not prepared nor understand the industry they are in. There is hope for Thompson Toronto as the saving grace is that the rooftop patio is a very nice spot. One of the best looking places in Toronto. Unfortunately, like CiRCA, the opportunity for Thompson Toronto could be squandered by bad management and developing a reputation for annoying their finicky visitors with their low-scale approach to service. I wish them the best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: punkazooie
Reviews.Content: When I stood at The Thompson, it was only 3 weeks old. The hotel is very trendy and clean. The location is great right in the heart of downtown. The staff was very attentive, the concierge was also nice enough to map out all the things we can do while in Toronto. The roof top is very nice, the infinity pool is very small but it has a nice view of the CN tower and the whole city. The roof top has day beds but it is first come first serve. You will need to get there very early cause there are only about 10 beds to accomodate all the guest. If the day beds are gone your only option is getting a table and it is about $50 minimum per person. The roof top lounge and pool is very small. The room itself is gorgeous and decent size compared to the LES NYC Thompson hotel. There is no parking on site but the hotel can valet your car for $30 a day or you can save the money and do what I did, I parked it across the street for $16 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Will be fantastic... when it is completely finished...”
Reviews.Author: Rdelpriore
Reviews.Content: We drove up to Toronto from Buffalo to watch a few Blue Jays/ St Louis Cardinals games as my boyfriend is a Cards fan This is our third trip together to Toronto, and we have previously stayed at the Grand Hotel and the Westin by the water. We loved the location of the Thompson, in the art and fashion district, and were frequent visitors to the bars and pubs down the streets. When we checked in, we had the valet park our car for the weekend, and realized at the end of the trip that it was $30 a night, a little pricey compared to the others but safer than parking ourselves. The lobby is a little dusty from all of the construction, and had a very modern layout, with mahogany and bright orange as their theme colors. You need your key to access any floors, which is safe but it took more than one swipe to activate it. When we were escorted to our room, the bellman showed us the layout and the multiple light settings (a little confusing at first) around the room, as we could control all the lights from the nightstand, which was nice. When we came back later on, we had been delivered fresh chocolate covered strawberries as a thank-you treat! We never had a drink at the rooftop bar, but stopped in to look around, and it was indeed beautiful. The weather was also amazing, which never hurts. I would have rather enjoyed lying by the pool during the day though, as it seemed a little cheesy at night. It is open not only to guests, but to condominium owners next door. Our bed was extremely comfortable, however there was construction starting very early in the morning, with people moving around ladders and other supplies. Because the hallway wasn't complete, it still looked a little industrial, more of an office hallway. Touch-up paint was also needed in many areas, including our room, which had a scuff marks on our white walls. The bathroom was gorgeous, with an awesome shower, but they only gave us two towels, and didn't give me any conditioner (which they brought up when we called). I think they're still trying to get organized, though, as there was no alarm clock in our room. The staff was young and friendly, and we enjoyed our meal in the restaurant/diner attached to the hotel. Supposedly, there is an awesome sushi restaurant opening within, but it was still in the process of being built. All-in-all, this will be a great hotel, but they should have worked out most of the kinks before they opened it. Definitely for a younger crowd like myself, as I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It's own worst enemy..”
Reviews.Author: SwissCanadian77
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a night at the Thompson Toronto and I was a little confused to say the least. I have stayed at the Thompson in NYC for business and it is a great vibe and a great atmosphere - true to it's 5 star rating. The Thompson Toronto either has to change it's star rating or change it's demographic for the type of clientele it is trying to attract. I would thoroughly like to know what the management thinks of the tattooed, knuckle-heads on the rooftop and how they think that they fit into the 5 star Thompson line. Most things to do with the hotel are 5 star (with some growing pains) but the pretentious, nonchalant air of the staff on the roof, coupled with the 2 star club-going crowd is a true disappointment for those travelers looking for 5 star service and atmosphere. Either Thompson needs to downgrade to 2 stars and let all the clubbers in and let the staff do what they want when they want... or they have to whip their staff into shape and clean up the rooftop! Five star setting for a jersey shore 2 star atmosphere... I don't think that doing body shots at the Thompson is what they had in mind when coming north to Toronto....

Reviews.Title: “A let down...”
Reviews.Author: mtlindiantraveller
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend night stay at the new Thompson Hotel in Toronto. The hotel itself is well situated, relative to the entertainment district in Toronto - restaurants, nightlife abound. The hotel has a feel more like a condo, than an actual hotel - the lobby minimalism doesn't work for me... our room was nice - esp the bed. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. Overall, I am not sure what vision the hotel had in mind - but what it is, is a hangout for weekend clubbers, and falls short of its chic NYC cousin... the hotel pool / lounge area is a refuge for wannabe mixed martial arts performance enhanced dudes creating a weird vibe to say the least... (agree with the one post comparing it to Jersey shore...) If you are planning a weekend of partying, stag adventures etc this is a good launching ground... If you are looking for a higher end boutique hotel i would sooner look at le germain, the hazelton, drake etc...

Reviews.Title: “I'm not cool enough to stay here”
Reviews.Author: RAMGOD
Reviews.Content: First and last time at Thompson. I stayed there last night and invited a couple of clients to join me in the bar for a drink. Upon arriving, I was told that I was only allowed to have ONE GUEST-in a hotel bar!!! Strangely enough, this hotel seems to need accommodate the very cool people to whom they have sold "memberships" to the bar and pool, This group seems to be the priority for them and hotel guests are a treated as a tolerable nuisance. I think they need to decide if they want to be a club or a hotel-this isn't Vegas! Anyway, things got from bad to worse and after about 10 minutes of arguing, the bouncer did not even allow me to return to the bar and finish my drink, claiming that the bar was now closed for a private party! We left in disgust and ended up having a fabulous time down the street at The Spoke Club. I will say that the front desk staff was extremely apologetic this am and removed any bar charges from my final bill. However, if you dont fit into the ultra cool demographic that the Thompson seems to want to cultivate, you will not feel very welcome at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “if you are over 40 stay away”
Reviews.Author: grajam
Reviews.Content: my husband and i with our 3 teenagers just checked out of the thompson hotel and i was not impressed to say the least. the service at check in was just average, i would have thought being a new hotel that the service would be extremely wonderful.. there was a mix up with my credit card and it took forever to get checked in, the rooms i must say were beautiful but a little over the top.. i guess that is what the younger crowds are looking for.. asked for ice and never received it, came back later after dinner and drinks and went to the roof top bar, felt alittle out of place with the younger crowd but thought we would check it out.. took forever to order a drink and then took forever or never for the girl to bring it, needless to say we left after 20 minutes of waiting for our drinks after we had waited 15-20 minutes to order.. the view from the roof top was spectacular, i found the whole visit very pretentious and a little too much for my liking.. will i go back, never but then never say never.. if you are between the ages of 20-35 you will have a blast.......if you are older i would definetely say no way......

Reviews.Title: “Bringing the New York/Miami vibe to the King West area”
Reviews.Author: AKCToronto
Reviews.Content: I hope that future hotels in Toronto consider the Thompson Toronto hotel as a marker for development because if more hotels start to create what the Thompson has done, then Toronto would be on par with the contemporary chic vibe in other major US cities. Given that this hotel just recently opened up, they are still working out some kinks so I won't go into considerable details on those issues. The deluxe room is definitely spatious and is more akin to a small condo with a good size bathroom. There are hardwood floors, heated marble bathroom floors, Ipod docker, rain shower and lot's of storage space. If your going to stay at this hotel, it's for the scene. The roof top has amazing views of the city and the sky line. During the day, you can lounge, soak it up, drink it up or swim it up there. This place has a really cool vibe on the roof top. The infinity pool is small however, and the residents of the hotel also gain access to this area. You may need to get there early to secure a lounger by the pool. You can see the pool area from the Gardiner. The evening's are more quiet and the action is definitely during the day. I would definitely recommend this place during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “A hip and cool hotel but needs some polishing.”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide_Church
Reviews.Content: We used to live in downtown Toronto for many years and we often return to visit family and friends so for our recent mid-June trip we thought we would stay at the new Thompson Hotel. We stayed at the Thompson in NYC and liked it so we were excited to hear that the Thompson Hotel opened in Toronto. The hotel is brand new so a lot of the amenities and none of the restaurants were open or were completed during our stay. So, I cannot give a complete and accurate assessment of the hotel. We booked a Deluxe King room. When we arrived at our room there was a welcome letter on the table. It was a nice gesture, however, it was another guest's name on the envelope and letter. The room had a nice view of the CN Tower. The decor is sleek and modern. The bed was very comfortable. There is a nice, small sitting area by the window. The room had plenty of storage space. The room lacked a clock radio and an ironing board and it only had one bath robe and there were only two bath towels, two hand towels and two face towels. It would be nice if there were at least a couple of extra bath towels so that guests could use them for the pool area or gym. Also, there really should be two bath robes for the room. You can call for more towels and an additional robe and probably for an ironing board but it should be unnecessary for guests to have to ask for these items that are usually mandatory at other hotels. Each room receives a copy of the Globe and Mail newspaper each morning. On our first morning we didn't receive a copy in front of our door. The rooftop pool is a beautiful infinity pool with amazing views of the city. There are two very nice bed loungers by the pool. There is a rooftop bar and lounge area by the pool with 360 degree views of the city which I can forsee becoming a city hotspot. The decor and vibe of the hotel is very hip, cool and modern. The lobby is very spacious with a bar slated to open in the area. The staff was courteous but needs more experience. For example, when my husband called for our car, the girl at the front desk loudly responded with, "What??????" She should have replied, "I'm sorry sir but can you please repeat what you just said?" Also, when we checked out, the front desk gave us the wrong bill. The hotel is located at Bathurst and Wellington Streets and is a hub of activity. If you walk a block up to King Street, there are many cafes, restaurants and bars. If you walk a bit further up to Queen Street, there are unique indie cafes and shops. There are also some popular clubs nearby within a few minutes walk to the hotel such as the Brant House and the C Lounge. If you want to venture to further parts of the city, you can easily catch a cab or take the Bathurst or King streetcars. Both of these will take you to the subway line. The Bathurst streetcar will take you to the Bloor line and the King streetcar will take you to the Yonge line. Overall, we had a nice stay at the Thompson but I will have to come back again once everything is finished so I can give an updated review. I think once everything is done and it has been in operation for a little longer, the hotel will be an amazing place to stay. So for now I'm only going to give it a three out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had known the hotel is nowhere near ready for guests!!”
Reviews.Author: torontojeff
Reviews.Content: Went to celebrate our anniversary--have loved the Thompson in NYC (60 and LES) the hotel is brand new in fact so new, nothing was open yet (Fitness room/lounge/pool/restaurants) and it still took 30 minutes to get my car! had I known none of this was ready yet i would have stayed elsewhere! maybe this will be the place to be in Toronto, but not for me
